ip_name: High-Throughput 3D Printing System
ip_description: This invention is a high-throughput 3D printing system that employs a multi-head configuration, complemented by custom objectives designed for an expanded field of view (FOV). This approach uses a custom-designed microscope objective with expanded FOV for greater accuracy during production. The system results in a significant increase in 3D printing throughput, enabling greater production efficiency and speed, and improving the current state of 3D nano-printing technology (two-photon polymerization, or TPP). The current two-photon polymerization (TPP) printing method has a notable drawback: its relatively low throughput, primarily due to the microscope objective's limited FOV, which is typically less than 1mm. While stitching methods have been employed to print larger elements, they are not ideal for optical elements because optical surfaces demand exceptional quality, and even minute variations at the transition regions between stitched areas can significantly degrade image quality. Furthermore, the restricted FOV of the objective lens hinders the potential of printing more than one element or system with the dimensions suitable for micro-optics using cutting-edge techniques. Applications include additive manufacturing, industrial manufacturing, automotive, healthcare, and aerospace. Advantages include greater production efficiency, improved field of view, lower materials cost, and greater production speed.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This high-throughput 3D printing system utilizes a multi-head configuration and custom microscope objectives with an expanded field of view (FOV) to enhance accuracy and significantly increase production efficiency and speed in 3D nano-printing, particularly in two-photon polymerization (TPP). The system overcomes limitations of traditional TPP methods, which suffer from low throughput due to restricted FOV.

**Applications:** Key use cases include additive manufacturing, industrial manufacturing, automotive, healthcare, and aerospace.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the low throughput of current two-photon polymerization methods, which is constrained by the limited FOV of microscope objectives, thereby enabling the production of high-quality optical elements without the drawbacks of stitching methods.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing 3D nano-printing, our high-throughput system utilizes a multi-head design and custom microscope objectives to dramatically expand the field of view, achieving unprecedented production speed and efficiency without compromising optical quality.

ip_name: A Method of Treating Fibrosis and Cancer across Organ Systems
ip_description: This technology is directed to a method of treating fibrosis and cancer by targeting circulating cells. Researchers identified mechanoresponsive myeloid subpopulations present in fibrotic and healthy tissue. Certain subpopulations of circulating cells have been implicated in the processes of cancer and fibrosis. These subpopulations are subsequently modulated by manipulating mechanical strain _in vivo_ and _in vitro_ and find that specifically targeting a certain type of signaling is sufficient to reduce the pro-fibrotic subpopulations and instead restore the native, anti-inflammatory subpopulations. Injury in all organs comprises of a coordinated process involving resident cells of the injury area as well as cells recruited from the circulation. Many recent studies have examined the importance of tissue resident fibroblast heterogeneity and mechanical signaling in healing and fibrosis. However, tissue repair also involves blood cells, part of the inflammatory response, that are recruited from the circulation. While the vast majority of circulating cells are immune cells, a rare population of cells have been identified in mammalian blood samples over two decades ago. However, since their initial description, the function, long term fate, and impact of these rare cells on peripheral tissues has been elusive. This technology seeks to explore the impact of modulation of these cells, specifically as it relates to inflammation in fibrosis and cancer. Applications include Fibrosis disease states such as Renal fibrosis, Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), Scleroderma, Liver Cirrhosis, Cancer, and Proliferative disease. Advantages include applicability to multiple organ systems and a large range of applicable disorders.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology involves a method for treating fibrosis and cancer by targeting specific circulating cell subpopulations that are mechanoresponsive. By manipulating mechanical strain, researchers can reduce pro-fibrotic cells and restore anti-inflammatory subpopulations, highlighting the role of both resident and circulating cells in tissue injury and repair.

**Applications:** The method can be applied to various fibrosis disease states, including renal fibrosis, idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), scleroderma, liver cirrhosis, and cancer.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the challenges of inflammation and fibrosis in multiple organ systems by modulating the behavior of rare circulating cell populations that influence these pathological processes.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing treatment for fibrosis and cancer, this groundbreaking method harnesses the power of mechanoresponsive circulating cell subpopulations to restore anti-inflammatory responses across multiple organ systems, offering hope for a wide array of debilitating diseases.

ip_name: Fluorophore-Doped Metal-Organic Frameworks for Quantifying Low-Energy Radionuclides in Aqueous Solutions
ip_description: This technology represents a new class of scintillation materials based on metal organic frameworks (MOFs), highly crystalline and tunable structures, which may provide higher detection efficiency compared to other particle scintillation materials. Furthermore, the use of fluorophores with these MOFs paves the way for more versatile applications in the realm of radioisotope detection. The unique combination enhances signal clarity, reducing background noise and increasing overall sensitivity. This breakthrough has the potential to revolutionize methods and protocols in research fields requiring precise radioisotope detection. Radioisotopes are used in clinical diagnosis, therapy of various medical conditions, environmental analyses, nuclear systems, and research in both the physical and life sciences. This involves the investigation of low-energy radiation emitting atoms in chemical solutions. To investigate these, however, requires techniques of detection that are currently cumbersome or unreliable. This is due to the inherent low energy emission making the atoms hard to detect in the first place as well as their weak emissions being unable to penetrate through much of the solution. The method described here is a novel and tunable chemical platform that provides a new strategy to detect low energy radioisotopes in aqueous solutions. The tunable platform enables highly efficient detection compared to other materials. Traditional methods of investigation require techniques of detection that are currently cumbersome or unreliable. Challenges arise due to the inherent low energy emission making the atoms hard to detect in the first place, compounded by their weak emissions being unable to penetrate through much of the solution. The fluorophore-doped MOF approach outlined in this technology not only addresses these challenges but offers a superior alternative. Applications include radioisotope detection and measurement, medical diagnostics, therapeutics, environmental analyses, nuclear systems analyses, and research. Advantages include increased efficiency, enhanced doping homogeneity, and enhanced precision.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology introduces a novel class of scintillation materials using fluorophore-doped metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), which offer higher detection efficiency for low-energy radionuclides in aqueous solutions. The tunable nature of these MOFs enhances signal clarity and sensitivity, making them a superior alternative to traditional detection methods.

**Applications:** Key applications include radioisotope detection and measurement, medical diagnostics and therapeutics, and environmental analyses.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenges of detecting low-energy emissions from radioisotopes, which are typically difficult to measure due to weak emissions and limited penetration in solutions, thereby improving detection reliability and efficiency.
llm_teaser: Unlocking unparalleled sensitivity in radioisotope detection, our fluorophore-doped metal-organic frameworks revolutionize the quantification of low-energy radionuclides in aqueous solutions, transforming research and applications across medical, environmental, and nuclear fields.

ip_name: Acquisition – Software to Control Acquisition of Images for Near-Earth Object Survey Operations
ip_description: The Acquisition subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey (CSS) software suite manages the operation of telescopes and instruments to capture data on asteroids and Near-Earth Objects (NEOs). Once areas of the sky are selected for observation, Acquisition takes over, accepting the input from the Planner subsystem and coordinating the telescope, camera, and other devices to efficiently gather data. It prioritizes observations based on their location and urgency, and it can automatically adjust to new requests in real time. The system is optimized to keep the camera in operation as much as possible, overlapping tasks such as image downloads and telescope movement to maximize performance. While Acquisition is designed for specific telescope hardware, it is built to be adaptable, allowing for relatively easy customization when transferring to other telescopes. This ensures the system can be used across different observatories, aligning with NASA’s Open-Source Data Management Plan to support global efforts in detecting hazardous asteroids. Current solutions to efficiently operate telescopes and instruments to track asteroids and Near-Earth Objects often involve manual adjustments or less automated systems that require separate control of telescopes, cameras, and other hardware. These approaches can lead to inefficiencies, such as delays between image captures or missed observations due to manual handling of equipment, and possible delays in handling real-time adjustments when new observation priorities arise. The Acquisition subsystem improves upon these issues by automating the entire process, ensuring that the telescope and camera are working together seamlessly. It prioritizes observations, manages telescope movements, and overlaps tasks like image downloads and focusing to maximize efficiency. The system can also adjust dynamically to new requests, making it faster and more responsive than traditional methods. This streamlined approach reduces downtime and increases the likelihood of capturing critical data, making it a more effective tool for NEO detection and tracking. Applications: Near-Earth Object detection and tracking, Astronomical survey operations, Space exploration and observation. Advantages: Automates telescope and camera operations for greater efficiency, Reduces downtime by overlapping tasks like image downloads and telescope movement, Adapts in real-time to new observation requests and priorities, Supports research in alignment with NASA's Open-Source Data Management Plan.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Acquisition subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey software automates the operation of telescopes and instruments for capturing data on Near-Earth Objects (NEOs). It efficiently coordinates tasks such as image downloads and telescope movements, prioritizes observations based on urgency, and adapts in real-time to new requests, enhancing overall operational efficiency.

**Applications:** Near-Earth Object detection and tracking, astronomical survey operations, space exploration and observation.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses inefficiencies in traditional telescope operations, which often rely on manual adjustments and separate control of equipment, leading to delays and missed observations. By automating the process, it reduces downtime and improves responsiveness to changing observation priorities.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing asteroid detection, the Acquisition software seamlessly automates telescope operations to maximize efficiency and responsiveness, ensuring no critical Near-Earth Object goes unnoticed."

ip_name: Planner – Planning Software for Near-Earth Object Survey Operations
ip_description: The Planner subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey (CSS) software suite is designed to help observers efficiently plan nightly asteroid and Near-Earth Object (NEO) observations. By displaying a virtual map of the sky, it helps ensure that areas previously searched, or areas unlikely to be productive, are avoided. The map shows the telescope’s current position and highlights objects requiring additional observations to improve orbit accuracy. It also indicates potential interference, such as the Moon or the Milky Way, and incorporates data from sources like the Minor Planet Center (MPC) and CSS’s own software. Observers can select specific objects or areas for observation, and this information is sent to the Acquisition subsystem for execution. This system helps streamline the planning process, improving coordination between telescopes and ensuring the most important observations are prioritized, supporting global asteroid research in alignment with NASA's Open-Source Data Management Plan. Efficiently planning and managing astronomical observations to track Near-Earth Objects and asteroids is needed to minimize redundant observations and ensure follow-up opportunities for objects that require additional data. Current solutions often involve manual planning or rely on basic software tools that may not provide real-time information or account for areas of the sky that have already been observed. Planner subsystem improves on these issues by automating the planning process and providing a comprehensive virtual map of the sky, which includes the position of the telescope, areas already observed, and objects that need further observation. It also integrates real-time data on potential interferences like the Moon or the Milky Way, ensuring that the most productive areas of the sky are prioritized. This makes the Planner subsystem more efficient and effective compared to traditional methods, reducing observational redundancies and enhancing the accuracy of NEO tracking efforts.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Planner subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey software suite automates the planning of asteroid and Near-Earth Object (NEO) observations by providing a virtual map of the sky that displays the telescope's position, previously searched areas, and objects needing further observation. It integrates real-time data on potential interferences and prioritizes the most productive observation areas, enhancing efficiency and coordination among telescopes.

**Applications:** This technology is primarily used in astronomical research, particularly for tracking Near-Earth Objects and asteroids, and supports global asteroid research initiatives in alignment with NASA's Open-Source Data Management Plan.

**Problem Solved:** The Planner subsystem addresses the challenges of manual planning and basic software tools that do not provide real-time information, reducing redundant observations and ensuring follow-up opportunities for critical NEO data collection.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionize your asteroid tracking with Planner, the cutting-edge software that automates observation planning and optimizes telescope efficiency by providing a real-time virtual sky map, ensuring no critical Near-Earth Object goes unnoticed."

ip_name: Processing – Software to Process and Analyze Images for NEO Survey
ip_description: The Processing subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey (CSS) software suite is a streamlined pipeline designed to handle raw images captured by telescopes during asteroid and Near-Earth Object (NEO) surveys. This pipeline processes the images through multiple stages, such as calibrating for optical distortions, extracting star or asteroid positions, and converting these positions into standard astronomical coordinates. By automating the process, the system allows multiple operations to occur simultaneously, improving efficiency and speeding up data analysis. The CSS pipeline incorporates widely used astronomical techniques and public-domain software to ensure accuracy and reliability. While the processing module handles all necessary steps for image analysis, it does not include moving object detection, which is released separately. The system applies filters to identify known asteroids, NEOs, or satellites, allowing for accurate reporting of new potential discoveries. All detections that successfully emerge from the moving object detection pipeline are presented to an observer for final validation running under Control. This technology aligns with NASA's Open-Source Data Management Plan to support global research in tracking hazardous asteroids. Processing large volumes of astronomical data to efficiently identify and track asteroids and Near-Earth Objects (NEOs) is challenging. Current solutions in NEO surveys often involve manual intervention or slower processing pipelines, which can delay the identification of new objects or overlook faint objects. These existing methods can be time-consuming, prone to errors, and may not allow for simultaneous handling of multiple operations, limiting their overall effectiveness in planetary defense. The CSS Processing subsystem improves on these issues by automating the image processing pipeline, enabling faster and more accurate data handling. Unlike traditional methods, it can perform multiple operations at once, such as calibrating for distortions and extracting object positions, speeding up the overall workflow. Its ability to filter out known objects and focus on potential new discoveries also reduces unnecessary data clutter. This approach streamlines the detection process and provides a more efficient way to analyze the vast amounts of data generated by NEO surveys.

**Summary:** The Processing subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey software suite automates the processing and analysis of raw images from asteroid and Near-Earth Object (NEO) surveys. It enhances efficiency by performing multiple operations simultaneously, such as calibrating optical distortions and extracting object positions, while ensuring accuracy through the use of established astronomical techniques and public-domain software.

**Applications:** This technology is primarily used in astronomical research, particularly in NEO tracking and planetary defense, as well as in any field requiring the analysis of large volumes of imaging data.

By automating the pipeline, it improves the speed and accuracy of data handling, reducing errors and enhancing the detection of potential discoveries.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing asteroid detection, the Processing subsystem of the Catalina Sky Survey automates and accelerates image analysis, enabling simultaneous operations that enhance accuracy and efficiency in identifying new Near-Earth Objects."

ip_name: Monitor – Software to Monitor Status of New and Recently Discovered Objects for NEO Survey
ip_description: The Monitor subsystem in the Catalina Sky Survey (CSS) software suite is designed to help track the status of newly discovered and recently observed asteroids and Near-Earth Objects (NEOs). It gathers data from various public sources, such as the Minor Planet Center and other NEO survey programs, to provide a clear and prioritized summary of which objects require further observation. This allows CSS observers to focus on the most important objects, ensuring efficient use of resources and reducing the risk of missing significant discoveries. The system displays this information on an internal webpage, improving coordination between telescopes and enabling quick updates on new or ongoing observations. By making this data accessible and easy to track, the monitor subsystem supports global research efforts, aligning with NASA's Open-Source Data Management Plan to aid other researchers in the search for potentially hazardous asteroids. The technology addresses the challenge of effectively tracking and monitoring Near-Earth Objects that could pose a collision threat to Earth. ip_name: Equanimity - Dynamic Physiology
ip_description:
This invention consists of a software package in combination with state-of-the-art hardware that is capable of continuously monitoring stress-related Heart Rate Variability (HRV). The software can recognize when HRV goes below a specified threshold and will prompt a yoga breathing exercise to increase HRV to healthier levels. The technology has the potential to provide a physiological marker and remedy for psychological stress for users.

Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is the measure of the variation in time between each heartbeat and is considered an index of vagal control of the heart that is a marker for physical and mental health. This variation is controlled by a primitive part of the nervous system called the autonomic nervous system (ANS).

HRV has been a topic with growing interest in both the e-health and fitness communities due to its straightforward measurement and potential insights it offers. Nonetheless, HRV measurements, which reflect the influence of both physical activity and psychological stress on heart function, currently lack the ability to distinguish between these two factors. As a result, current measures of HRV provide a weak marker of psychological stress.

Applications:
*   Physical health and fitness
*   Mental health
*   Stress monitoring

Advantages:
*   Uses a method that yields a purer indicator of central nervous system influences on HRV
*   Measures physical activity and HRV simultaneously but can also separate out variances in HRV due to movement
*   Real-time measurements and results
*   Continuous monitoring for stress-related HRV
*   Integrates actionable tasks to reduce stress
llm_summary:
**Summary:** Equanimity - Dynamic Physiology is a software and hardware solution that continuously monitors stress-related Heart Rate Variability (HRV) and prompts users to engage in yoga breathing exercises when HRV falls below a certain threshold. This technology provides real-time measurements and integrates actionable tasks to help users manage psychological stress.

**Applications:** The technology can be applied in physical health and fitness, mental health, and stress monitoring.

**Problem Solved:** This invention addresses the challenge of accurately measuring psychological stress through HRV by providing a clearer indicator of central nervous system influences and distinguishing between variances in HRV due to physical activity and stress.
llm_teaser: "Equanimity - Dynamic Physiology empowers users to combat psychological stress in real-time by seamlessly monitoring heart rate variability and prompting personalized yoga breathing exercises, transforming physiological insights into actionable wellness."

The ability to re-use these teaching tools lowers cost over time and is more reliable for testing students in objective structured clinical examinations (OSCES), as opposed to single-use tools that may deteriorate over time. Moreover, these 3D printed urine crystals provide a tangible and visually detailed educational resource that enhances veterinary medical students’ understanding. The American Veterinary Medical Association (AVMA) Council on Education (COE) mandates hands-on training experiences in diagnostic urinalysis as part of veterinary medical education programs at accredited colleges. Traditional methods of teaching diagnostic urinalysis often rely on static images or generic models that may not accurately represent the diverse and intricate structures of urine crystals. Current solutions often lack the tactile and visual fidelity required for effective learning, hindering students in developing the necessary skills for accurate diagnosis. These models enhance the learning experience by providing a tactile and visually detailed resource for teaching diagnostic urinalysis, making them more effective than traditional static images or generic models.

ip_name: Solid Set Flood Irrigation
ip_description: This invention is a solid-set irrigation bubbler head sprinkler system designed to replace existing low-output sprinkler heads commonly used in agricultural fields. The design of the system directs the water downward to guide it toward the soil while simultaneously controlling the flow to prevent soil erosion. This innovation allows for more precise flooding of fields and precise fertilizer applications. The solution devised by the team at Yuma County Cooperative Extension promises to significantly improve the efficiency of flood irrigation for secondary crops, leading to more sustainable and productive agricultural practices in Arizona and beyond. Historically, secondary crops have relied on “basin flood irrigation,” a low-cost method that flattens the land and opens a single canal gate to flood the field gradually. This is crucial not only for providing the necessary water and nutrients to the crops but also for dissolving and washing away accumulated salt. However, the challenge with traditional flood irrigation has been uneven water distribution across the field, with more water infiltrating near the canal gate and less at the opposite end. This leads to suboptimal crop growth, as well as salt accumulation in some areas, which can be detrimental to crop health. By replacing low-output sprinkler heads, this innovation enhances the overall efficiency and effectiveness of flood irrigation, promoting healthier crop growth and reducing the environmental impact associated with excessive water and fertilizer use. Applications include agricultural irrigation, pre-irrigation, and salt leaching. Advantages include enabling accurate, faster, more even water distribution across fields, more efficient field flooding, nutrient application, and salt removal, faster irrigation sets, less overall water use, healthier crop growth from more consistent and reliable irrigation, and compliance with sustainable farming practices and irrigation efficiency standards.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention is a solid-set irrigation bubbler head sprinkler system that improves flood irrigation efficiency by directing water downward and controlling flow to prevent soil erosion. It allows for precise flooding and fertilizer application, enhancing crop growth and sustainability in agricultural practices.

**Applications:** The primary use cases include agricultural irrigation, pre-irrigation, and salt leaching.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the issue of uneven water distribution in traditional flood irrigation, which can lead to suboptimal crop growth and salt accumulation, thereby promoting healthier crops and reducing environmental impact.
llm_teaser: Revolutionize your farming with Solid Set Flood Irrigation, a groundbreaking bubbler head system that ensures precise, even water distribution for healthier crops while minimizing water usage and environmental impact.

ip_name: Scattering Based Light Sheet Microscope
ip_description: This invention relates to designs of a low-cost scattering-based light sheet microscope that provides microscopic images of human tissue in vivo. The key idea is to use an incoherent line light source with a rectangular aperture to generate light sheet illumination and detect the scattered light from the illuminated tissue plane to generate images. The use of line illumination and rectangular aperture provides a small illumination light sheet width over a large field of view, while reducing the speckle noise and shadow artifacts. This innovative approach towards the design of this microscope promises enhanced clarity and precision in imaging. Given its affordability, this invention is poised to revolutionize diagnostic procedures in various medical settings, especially in regions with limited access to advanced medical equipment. Light sheet microscopy (LSM) is a relatively new microscopy technology used in basic life science research. LSM uses separate optical paths for illumination and detection, where the illumination optics determine the axial resolution, and the detection optics determine the lateral resolution. This invention can be used to develop low-cost, small form-factor light sheet microscopy devices for diagnosing diseases of human internal organs in vivo and freshly excised specimens ex vivo, including anus, esophagus, stomach, duodenum, and colon. The microscope device can be used in a wide range of clinical settings (including primary-care clinics, surgical suites, and under-resourced remote hospitals without pathology services), as well as for training and educational purposes. Furthermore, the advancements in LSM technology, combined with the unique features of this invention, present a transformative opportunity. The potential to deliver high-resolution imaging at a fraction of the cost of current technologies can significantly improve early disease detection and provide essential insights into cellular dynamics and structures.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention is a low-cost scattering-based light sheet microscope designed to provide high-resolution microscopic images of human tissue in vivo using an incoherent line light source and a rectangular aperture. Its innovative design reduces speckle noise and shadow artifacts, enhancing clarity and precision in imaging.

**Applications:** The microscope can be utilized in various clinical settings, including primary-care clinics, surgical suites, and remote hospitals, for diagnosing diseases of internal organs such as the anus, esophagus, stomach, duodenum, and colon. It also serves educational and training purposes.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the need for affordable and accessible diagnostic imaging solutions in medical settings, particularly in areas with limited access to advanced equipment, thereby improving early disease detection and insights into cellular dynamics.
llm_teaser: Unlock the future of medical diagnostics with our groundbreaking low-cost scattering-based light sheet microscope, designed to deliver high-resolution, in vivo imaging of human tissue with unparalleled clarity, making advanced healthcare accessible even in the most resource-limited settings.

ip_name: Perceptual-Driven Foveated Optical See-Through Head-Mounted Displays
ip_description: This invention consists of the design and embodiments of a statically optical see through head-mounted displays (OST-HMDs) in which the angular pixel density decreases with the increase of the filed eccentricity according to a specified angular pixel density function. To facilitate the head-mounted display capability to simultaneously see the image rendered by a display and the view go the real-world scene, a freeform prism is utilized as the optical combiner to merge the optical paths of the virtual image display and real-world view. The implementation of the described features creates minimally perceivable image artifacts and image resolution discontinuity and may further eliminate or limit the need for an eye tracker or scanning mechanism. Head-mounted displays (HMDs) have been created for numerous effective purposes, including training, medical education, navigation, and various other applications. Traditional HMD configurations utilize the widely accepted rectilinear sampling approach, which is primarily employed in 2D display and imaging systems. As a result of using such configurations, conventional HMD are subject to the inherent trade-off between field of view (FOV) and resolution. To alleviate the trade-off between FOV and resolution, a foveated display, inspired by the foveation properties of the human eye, can be generally defined as a method that identifies a user's region of interest (ROI) and allocates limited resources, such as a finite number of pixels or data processing and transmission bandwidth, differently between the ROI and the peripheral area outside the ROI region.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention features a perceptual-driven foveated optical see-through head-mounted display (OST-HMD) that adjusts angular pixel density based on field eccentricity, utilizing a freeform prism to merge virtual and real-world views. It minimizes image artifacts and resolution discontinuity, potentially reducing the need for eye tracking or scanning mechanisms.

**Applications:** The technology is applicable in training, medical education, navigation, and various other fields that utilize head-mounted displays.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the trade-off between field of view and resolution in traditional HMDs by employing a foveated display approach that optimally allocates resources based on the user's region of interest.
llm_teaser: Experience unparalleled visual clarity and immersion with our Perceptual-Driven Foveated Optical See-Through Head-Mounted Displays, which intelligently optimize pixel density to seamlessly blend virtual imagery with the real world while minimizing artifacts and eliminating the need for eye tracking.

ip_name: PNA5 Treatment in Myocardial Ischemic Reperfusion Injury Decreases Infarction Size and Promotes Heart Function
ip_description: This innovation is a novel method of treating cardiovascular disease, specifically, the continued tissue damage that occurs during myocardial ischemic reperfusion injury (MIRI) elicited by myocardial ischemia. While damage during MIRI is multifaceted, this new treatment addresses nearly every caveat including reactive oxygen species (ROS), calcium overload, and multiple inflammatory responses. Studies completed by the innovators have shown that the PNA5 treatment reduced infarct size by 35.02% compared to the control-treated animals, decreased regional fibrosis compared to control-treated mice, and preserved heart function. While reperfusion therapies are required to address myocardial ischemia successfully, the continued tissue damage that occurs during myocardial ischemic reperfusion injury (MIRI) can negatively impact the recovery of the heart’s structure and function. The treatment of choice for reducing acute myocardial ischemic injury and limiting MI size is timely and effective myocardial reperfusion using either thrombolytic therapy or primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PPCI). However, the process of reperfusion can itself induce cardiomyocyte death, known as myocardial reperfusion injury, for which there is still no effective therapy.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This innovation, PNA5 treatment, offers a novel approach to mitigate myocardial ischemic reperfusion injury (MIRI) by addressing factors such as reactive oxygen species, calcium overload, and inflammatory responses. Studies indicate that it reduces infarct size by 35.02% and preserves heart function compared to control treatments.

**Applications:** The primary use case is in the treatment of cardiovascular diseases, particularly in managing myocardial ischemic reperfusion injury. It may also be relevant in the development of therapies for acute myocardial ischemic injury.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the ongoing tissue damage caused by MIRI that negatively affects heart recovery after reperfusion therapies, for which there is currently no effective treatment.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing cardiac care, the PNA5 treatment significantly reduces infarct size by over 35% and enhances heart function by targeting the complex damage caused during myocardial ischemic reperfusion injury.

ip_name: Damped Flexure Mount
ip_description: The invention is a dampened flexure mount capable of enhancing the vibration isolation of highly sensitive equipment, including optics, aerospace, and space applications. The mount’s improved dampening capability arises from the incorporation of two or more materials in its design, where one imparts rigidity, while the other imparts flex dampening properties. The design adopts the concept of constrained layer damping. Here, a viscoelastic material is sandwiched between the mount and a rigid constraining layer. Vibrational energy, instead of adversely impacting the equipment, causes shearing in the viscoelastic layer. Over time, this vibrational energy transforms into heat in the viscoelastic layer, ensuring the vibrations do not disturb the equipment’s operation. The design has a Z flexure as well as X and Y, so it is quasi-kinematic in all axes. Flexural mounts are commonly employed, particularly in optics, to create quasi-kinematic supports for components. In most optical applications, the environmental conditions are often benign. However, in scenarios where applications must endure harsh vibrations, such as during a space launch, it is often desirable to attenuate this excitation originating from the base of the structure to protect the delicate optics, detectors, and other supported components. The challenge lies in achieving the right balance between rigid support and damping capabilities. Over the years, many efforts have been made to address this concern, but finding an optimal solution that can cater to both the precision required by optical components and the durability needed to withstand intense vibrations remains a challenge. The key advantage of this type of mount is its monolithic (i.e., one-piece) construction, which precisely holds a component in place in perfect equilibrium without excessive constraint.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Damped Flexure Mount is designed to enhance vibration isolation for sensitive equipment by utilizing a combination of materials that provide both rigidity and dampening properties. Its innovative design incorporates constrained layer damping, allowing vibrational energy to be converted into heat, ensuring minimal disturbance to the equipment's operation.

**Applications:** This technology is particularly useful in optics, aerospace, and space applications, where it supports delicate components during harsh vibration conditions, such as space launches.

**Problem Solved:** The mount addresses the challenge of balancing rigid support with effective damping capabilities, protecting sensitive equipment from vibrations while maintaining precision alignment.
llm_teaser: Experience unparalleled vibration isolation for sensitive equipment with the Damped Flexure Mount, expertly engineered to combine rigidity and advanced dampening properties, ensuring optimal performance in even the harshest environments.

This mouse model harbors an intestine-specific disruption in DRP-1, a key mitochondrial membrane-associated protein, which will be useful in assessing how mitochondrial structure/interaction influences enteric pathogen disease and basic intestinal cell biology. **Summary:** This invention features a transgenic DRP-1-/- mouse model that specifically disrupts the DRP-1 protein in the intestine, allowing for in-depth research into mitochondrial dynamics and their impact on gastrointestinal health. It provides a relevant physiological context for studying various gastrointestinal conditions and diseases.

**Applications:** Key applications include mammalian intestinal research, gastrointestinal energetics in the context of infection and cancer, and studies on metabolic diseases and gut-microbiome interactions.

ip_name: AI-Based Synthetic Generation of Radio-Frequency Maps in Wireless Communication Systems
ip_description: This technology is a novel, cost-effective method which creates radiofrequency (RF) maps used in wireless communication. The improvement is that this technology can use previous RF maps as inputs and with the help of sophisticated artificial intelligence, produce new areas or new capabilities with the requirement of significant field measurements. This inventive method presents a valuable solution for efficiently generating RF maps and overcoming the complexities associated with site surveys, ray tracing, and other existing techniques. This technology can be used in any type of synthesizing heat maps, such as, weather heat maps, heat maps in biological imaging, etc., as well as for enhanced network planning, interference coordination, resource allocation, and localization. The technology is expected to achieve half the error rate of existing technologies. The process of constructing RF maps becomes even more complex at high frequencies (e.g., millimeter-wave band), as many configurations must be investigated. Alternative state-of-the-art techniques for RF map generation rely on ray-tracing approaches. Advantages include Greater efficiency, Reduced error rate, Cost-effective, and Novel method.

**Summary:** This technology offers a cost-effective, AI-driven method for generating radio-frequency (RF) maps in wireless communication systems, utilizing existing RF maps to produce new data with minimal field measurements. **Applications:** Key use cases include networking and telecommunications, aerospace and defense, and heat mapping in various industries such as weather analysis and biological imaging.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenges of time-consuming and labor-intensive RF map construction, which is complicated by the dynamic nature of wireless environments and various factors affecting signal propagation.

ip_name: Iron Targeting to Halt Proliferation in Malignant Cells
ip_description: This invention comprises a class of tetrazolium-based prochelators for targeting and binding intracellular iron and thereby interfere in cancer cell proliferation or other iron dysregulation. The redox potential of various analogues within this class of compounds can be tuned for targeting of cancer cells. Following cellular uptake, the tetrazolium compounds of the present invention undergo reduction to produce formazan species that are capable of intracellular binding of various metals. In this approach, the initial prochelator compound forms an active metal-binding chelator under specific conditions in order to minimize indiscriminate depletion of essential metal ions and potential side effects. The tetrazolium prochelators are stable in blood serum and present antiproliferative activities at micromolar concentrations, as confirmed against a panel of various cancer cell lines. Multiple cell-based assays demonstrate that the compounds impact intracellular iron signaling and that the toxicity is associated, at least in part, to iron sequestration. Iron is an essential element and is the most abundant transition metal in humans. The normal functions of human cells rely on iron due to its vital role in oxygen transport, energy generation, and DNA synthesis. Altered metabolism and homeostasis of transition metal ions (such as iron, copper, and zinc) are associated with several pathological conditions including cancer and neurodegeneration. Thus, metal-binding compounds (chelators) that affect metal availability in disease conditions may be potential drug candidates. Malignant cells have a higher demand for iron to sustain their rapid proliferation rates. As a result, targeting iron metabolism in cancer cells has become a promising strategy in cancer therapy. Iron chelation therapy is a treatment that removes iron in the organism by utilizing a small-molecule scavenger. This invention uses tetrazolium salts as prochelators, namely precursors to iron chelators that can limit intracellular iron availability and cause cell death. The invention relates to methods of making the tetrazolium salts and methods of treatment using the compounds.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention introduces a class of tetrazolium-based prochelators designed to target and bind intracellular iron, thereby inhibiting cancer cell proliferation. The compounds are stable in blood serum, exhibit antiproliferative activities at micromolar concentrations, and can be tuned for specific targeting of cancer cells while minimizing side effects.

**Applications:** Potential applications include cancer therapy, particularly in treatments that involve iron chelation, as well as research into metal dysregulation in various pathological conditions such as neurodegeneration.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of altered iron metabolism in malignant cells, which have a heightened demand for iron to support rapid proliferation, by providing a method to limit intracellular iron availability and induce cell death.
llm_teaser: Unlocking a revolutionary approach to cancer therapy, this innovative class of tetrazolium-based prochelators selectively targets and sequesters intracellular iron in malignant cells, effectively halting their proliferation while preserving essential metal ion balance.

ip_name: A Method to Increase the Solubility of the Flavonoid Rutin for Biological Assays and Administration for Protective Effects
ip_description:
This technology consists of an improved method for maximizing the solubility of the flavonoid rutin to effectively protect bees against the harmful effects of fipronil and deltamethrin, two types of commonly used pesticides. This technology serves as a non-toxic alternative to the current method of rutin dissolution, with no physiological or cognitive side effects on the honeybees themselves. Notably, this method offers a promising approach for enhancing the bioavailability of rutin, thus potentially amplifying its therapeutic and protective benefits.

Flavonoids are nutraceutical molecules derived from plants and studied for more than a century in diverse contexts, from cell culture to clinical trials. However, constraints in flavonoid solubility in water have been a challenge for research and administration. As the main alternative, Dimethyl Sulfoxide (DMSO) is used to dissolve flavonoids as well as other polar and nonpolar molecules. DMSO has been widely recognized for its presumed non-toxicity and is approved for tests in toxicology. However, recent evidence suggests that DMSO may be toxic even at low concentrations, questioning its reliability in bioassays. This evidence purports the need for an alternative for flavonoid dissolution.

Applications:
* Honeybee research
* Flavonoid dissolution
* Agriculture research/practices
* General biomedical research

Advantages:
* Non-toxic alternative to traditional methods
* Provides cognitive protection for honeybees
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology presents an improved method for enhancing the solubility of the flavonoid rutin, enabling its effective use in protecting honeybees from harmful pesticides like fipronil and deltamethrin. It offers a non-toxic alternative to traditional dissolution methods, ensuring no adverse physiological or cognitive effects on the bees.

**Applications:** Key use cases include honeybee research, flavonoid dissolution, agriculture research/practices, and general biomedical research.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of low solubility of flavonoids in water, which has hindered research and administration, while providing a safer alternative to the potentially toxic solvent Dimethyl Sulfoxide (DMSO).

ip_name: Wide Area Spectralelectrochemical Measurement of Thin Film Semiconductors for Electronic Band Structure Analysis
ip_description: This invention is a rapid, nondestructive detection method for properties of semiconductor stacks (including perovskite stacks for use in photovoltaics) which can be used at speeds and scales relevant for manufacturing to check product quality. This invention could reduce/remove barriers for manufacturing scale-up and production of high quality robust next generation photovoltaics. The physical properties and chemical characteristics of perovskite thin films and their contact interfaces are complex and defects arising in these materials may be stochastic. Very sophisticated measurement and analysis techniques to determine the quality of these materials and composites may not be suitable or practical for manufacturability. Therefore, there is a need for effective measurement techniques which can support scaled-up manufacturing. A new technology presented here is a spectro-electrochemical measurement of energy levels. This measurement technique can be applied for a wide area and at speeds relevant for manufacturing and results in determining characteristic of multilayer stacks, including the portions of material "buried" in the stack, such as interfaces. This technique is a broad concept that may be suitable for application to other multi-layer semiconductor stacks comprising many semiconductor layers. Applications include photovoltaic manufacturing, semiconductor manufacturing, and aerospace and defense. Advantages include scalability to manufacturing, precise measurement capability, enabling industrial scale manufacturing, added quality control, and added quality assurance.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention provides a rapid, nondestructive method for measuring the properties of semiconductor stacks, particularly perovskite thin films used in photovoltaics. The spectro-electrochemical measurement technique enables effective analysis of multilayer stacks, including buried interfaces, at manufacturing-relevant speeds and scales.

**Applications:** Key applications include photovoltaic manufacturing, semiconductor manufacturing, and aerospace and defense.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the need for effective measurement techniques that support scaled-up manufacturing of high-quality, robust next-generation photovoltaics, overcoming challenges posed by complex material properties and stochastic defects.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing semiconductor manufacturing, this rapid, nondestructive spectro-electrochemical measurement technique enables precise quality control of multilayer stacks, including perovskite photovoltaics, ensuring robust production at scale while uncovering hidden material properties and defects.

ip_name: Angular Tuning of Axial Resonance in Periodic Grating Structures Design Strategy for Operating Multi-Channel CW or Mode-Locked Pulsed VECSELs
ip_description: This invention can be used to develop tunable wavelength VECSEL/VCSEL/OPSL sources. This can also be used to tune absorption bands in periodic absorbers or any periodic media. This allows for engineering of tunability of a source. Furthermore, the adaptability of this invention permits the utilization of multiple wavelength ranges without needing to swap out hardware components, offering a seamless and efficient user experience. Current technologies lack the range of tuning that this invention provides the user. The key innovation here is a method to tune and engineer coherence/lasing/absorption wavelengths as a function of angle for vertically integrated periodic media. Or put another way, this is a way to tune tiny semiconductor “lasers” used in communications equipment to change frequencies (think of it going from red to green) using just a mirror with little prisms and such on it. This novel approach bypasses the limitations faced by traditional laser tuning methods, reducing both complexity and potential points of failure in the system. In a world that's rapidly advancing towards the proliferation of optical technologies in various sectors, the importance of such a tuning method cannot be overstated. From faster internet connections to cutting-edge medical devices, the demand for versatile and adaptive optical systems is increasing. The inefficiencies and limitations of older systems become evident as they struggle to keep up with the newer demands. This invention addresses this technological gap, offering a groundbreaking method to push the boundaries of what's possible with optical technologies. Applications include Telecommunications, Spectroscopy, Imaging and sensing technologies, Medical diagnostics, and Research and development of new technologies. Advantages include Greater range of tuning, Cost effective, and Increased versatility.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention provides a method for tuning and engineering coherence, lasing, and absorption wavelengths in vertically integrated periodic media by adjusting the angle, enabling tunable wavelength sources for VECSELs, VCSELs, and OPSLs. It allows for the seamless use of multiple wavelength ranges without hardware changes, enhancing user experience and reducing system complexity.

**Applications:** Key applications include telecommunications, spectroscopy, imaging and sensing technologies, medical diagnostics, and research and development of new technologies.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the limitations of traditional laser tuning methods, offering a greater range of tuning and increased versatility, which is essential for meeting the growing demands of modern optical technologies.
llm_teaser: Unlock unparalleled versatility in optical technologies with our innovative angular tuning method, enabling seamless wavelength adjustments in VECSELs and periodic media without hardware swaps, revolutionizing applications from telecommunications to medical diagnostics.

ip_name: Hostage Negotiator Throw Phone
ip_description: The UAPD Throw Phone is a two-way audio/video communication device, tailored specifically for use by hostage negotiators. In critical incidents, it plays a pivotal role, allowing negotiators to engage with and de-escalate barricaded subjects. The primary goal is to foster peaceful resolution and ensure the safety of all parties involved. It will need to address the ruggedness and poor network challenges relevant to this application. In the past, throw phones have generally been heavy, bulky, hard wired phone systems which required several SWAT members to put themselves at great risk to deliver the cumbersome phone system into critical incidents to enable open communication and de-escalate barricaded subjects in order to resolve the standoff peacefully and save lives. This invention would reduce the size and weight of previous systems to enable greater ease in transporting a wireless communication device to said subjects. Building on the traditional concept of throw phones, the UAPD Throw Phone innovates by incorporating both audio and video capabilities. This dual functionality enhances the ability of law enforcement to gauge situations and make informed decisions. The objective remains clear: creating an avenue for dialogue that can defuse tense standoffs and prioritize the preservation of life.

**Summary:** The UAPD Throw Phone is a compact, lightweight two-way audio/video communication device designed for hostage negotiators to facilitate dialogue with barricaded subjects. It enhances situational awareness and decision-making through its dual functionality, promoting peaceful resolutions in critical incidents.

ip_name: Identity Verification using Answering Correctness and Behavior for Geo-Location Entities (Roads and Points of Interest) Relevant to a User's Primary Address
ip_description: The Geographical Knowledge Based Verification (GeoKBA) System is an advanced multifactor verification service integrating a geographical component with digital behavioral biometrics to verify user identities in web-based interfaces. Conventional multifactor authentication (MFA) consists of “something you know” (e.g., a password) and “something you have” (e.g., a cell phone that receives a temporary code) to greatly enhance verification accuracy. GeoKBA extends this model, employing “something you know” and “something you do” by simultaneously testing users on two factors relative to their familiarity with specific geographic locations (i.e., geo-targets), assessing responses in terms of objective accuracy as well as behavioral patterns exhibited while providing those responses. The GeoKBA approach greatly increases accuracy and security over single factor approaches and presents and collects these dual factors in a single process for a better user experience. Unlike existing KBA methods, the GeoKBA approach will work with first touch users (e.g., account opening) or repeat users (e.g., password reset). The evolving landscape of cyber threats necessitates innovations like GeoKBA, which not only act as an additional protective layer but also anticipate and counter newer hacking methods by rooting identity verification in the real-world attribute of geographical location. The alarming rate of hacking incidents and the sophisticated techniques employed by cybercriminals underscore the pressing need for reinforced identity verification methods to protect internet users as they exchange and store sensitive personal information and financial data. By leveraging geographical data, which is inherently difficult for hackers to replicate or misuse, GeoKBA addresses one of the core vulnerabilities in conventional verification methods. This combination of “knowing” and “doing” ensures a multi-dimensional authentication process. As online interfaces evolve and the demand for secure transactions grows, technologies like GeoKBA become indispensable in maintaining the integrity and security of digital transactions.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The GeoKBA System is an advanced multifactor verification service that combines geographical knowledge with digital behavioral biometrics to enhance user identity verification in web-based interfaces. It assesses users based on their familiarity with specific geographic locations and their behavioral patterns, significantly improving accuracy and security over traditional methods.

**Applications:** Key use cases include online account creation, password resets, and secure transactions in industries such as finance, e-commerce, and any sector requiring robust identity verification.

**Problem Solved:** GeoKBA addresses vulnerabilities in conventional verification methods by incorporating geographical data, which is difficult for hackers to replicate, thereby providing a more secure identity verification process in response to the increasing sophistication of cyber threats.
llm_teaser: Unlock unparalleled security with GeoKBA, the revolutionary identity verification system that combines geographical knowledge and behavioral biometrics to ensure your online transactions are as secure as they are seamless.

ip_name: Method, System and Device for Water Conservation and Dialysate Recycling
ip_description: The technology is a method to recycle water that is used during dialysis. By using activated charcoal, urease, zirconium oxide and zirconium phosphate to filter the water of contaminants, this method can make water achieve a purity level that is acceptable for clinical reuse. As dialysis becomes an essential treatment for an increasing number of patients globally, the need for water conservation in the process is paramount. By allowing water to be recycled for clinical reuse, this technology not only contributes to environmental sustainability but also ensures a steady supply of purified water for uninterrupted dialysis sessions. Dialysis is a method used to eliminate waste substances and surplus fluids from the bloodstream in situations where the kidneys are not functioning adequately. Typically, this process entails redirecting the blood to a specialized machine for thorough purification (NHS). Current systems use a hollow fiber kidney system to exchange fluid, electrolytes, and waste with dialysate. However, these systems are non-portable, requiring access to a large water and dialysate source in a hospital or clinic setting. The new technology aims to fix that by recapturing dialysate and water, so that it can be reused. While traditional dialysis procedures are effective in their purpose, the consumption of water in large quantities remains a concern. Modern medical advancements necessitate the development of more sustainable methods, ensuring both the well-being of patients and a reduced ecological footprint. The introduction of technologies that promote the efficient use of resources in medical treatments is a step forward in achieving a balance between healthcare and environmental conservation. Applications: Dialysis, Hemodialysis, Integrated medical systems. Advantages: Water can achieve a purity level for clinical reuse, Cost efficient, Conserves water and supports sustainability.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology provides a method for recycling water used in dialysis by utilizing activated charcoal, urease, zirconium oxide, and zirconium phosphate to filter contaminants, achieving a purity level suitable for clinical reuse. It addresses the growing need for water conservation in dialysis, ensuring a steady supply of purified water while promoting environmental sustainability.

**Applications:** Dialysis, Hemodialysis, Integrated medical systems.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the significant water consumption associated with traditional dialysis procedures, offering a sustainable solution that reduces ecological impact while maintaining patient care standards.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing dialysis, this innovative water recycling technology purifies and reuses water, ensuring a sustainable supply for treatment while significantly reducing environmental impact.

ip_name: New Deuterated Amino Acid Derivatives
ip_description: Compositions and methods of making involve the use of alternative acids as reactants instead of carboxylic acids, which produce deuterated amino acids, while carboxylic acids can only synthesize alkyl amino acids. Introducing deuterium to amino acids and derivatives improves biologically active compounds and therapeutics. Modification improves properties such as metabolic stability and minimizes racemization in peptide and peptidomimetic therapeutics to enhance performance. Existing procedures for production of deuterated amino acids have problems including issues with selectivity, the amount of amino acid deuterated, and the enantiomeric purity of products. There is a need for improved production approaches that will allow manufacturers to better keep up with increasing demand. While little progress has been made in production methods for some time, this invention is not the only new approach vying to supplant existing techniques: methods from the Soloshonok group are being commercially developed, making this a potentially competitive field as more groups attempt to solve these same issues. Applications include: Proteomics, Mass spectrometry, Nuclear magnetic resonance techniques, Drug discovery and development, Metabolic and biosynthetic pathway research, Protein structure research. Advantages include: More metabolic stability, Enhanced performance of therapeutics, Diverse applications, Minimizes racemization in drug synthesis.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The technology involves new compositions and methods for synthesizing deuterated amino acid derivatives using alternative acids, which enhance the metabolic stability and performance of biologically active compounds and therapeutics. This approach addresses existing challenges in selectivity, yield, and enantiomeric purity in the production of deuterated amino acids.

**Applications:** Key applications include proteomics, mass spectrometry, nuclear magnetic resonance techniques, drug discovery and development, and protein structure research.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the limitations of current production methods for deuterated amino acids, including issues with selectivity and enantiomeric purity, while meeting the growing demand for these compounds in various scientific fields.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing drug development, our new deuterated amino acid derivatives enhance metabolic stability and therapeutic performance by utilizing alternative acids for superior selectivity and enantiomeric purity."

ip_name: Advanced Fire Weather Analysis and Decision Making Dashboard
ip_description: This technology is a dashboard that has the capability of gathering data from multiple independent forest service data sources to aid in the identification and prediction of potential fire weather, as well as the impact of weather on fire events. Moreover, the dashboard incorporates advanced machine learning algorithms for dynamic and predictive modeling, integrating streamlined data science methods, optimized aggregation, and visualization techniques, along with new fire weather forecast products. These features enable it to adapt to continually changing forest conditions and to provide proactive solutions for potential wildfire threats. Wildfire management presents complex challenges as a result of climate change and shifting weather patterns, which impact fuel and ignition sources. The proposed fire information portal aims to address them by leveraging abundant data for better fire risk management, decision support, and planning. By blending the use of modern data science techniques with more traditional knowledge of fire ecology and meteorology, this technology seeks to bridge the gap between science, decision-making, and on-the-ground firefighting efforts, thereby improving the ability to anticipate and mitigate the risks posed by wildfires. It utilizes advanced machine learning algorithms for dynamic modeling and visualization, enabling proactive wildfire risk management and adaptation to changing forest conditions.

llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing wildfire management, our Advanced Fire Weather Analysis and Decision Making Dashboard harnesses cutting-edge machine learning and real-time data integration to predict fire risks and empower proactive decision-making for more effective firefighting strategies."

ip_name: UV-Curable Thiol-ene System for Broadband Infrared Transparent Objects
ip_description: This invention is a UV-curable Thiol-ene system that marks a significant advancement in the production of infrared (IR) transparent materials. This solution harnesses an original thiol-ene strategy, which employs a meticulously designed combination of multithiols and divinyl oligomers (DVO). These components are exclusively comprised of C, H, and S atoms, ensuring a distinct level of transparency across a wide spectrum, from visible light all the way to long-wave IR (LWIR). This comprehensive approach empowers a more effective production of IR transparent objects, bolstering efficiency while paving the way for new opportunities in space exploration and optical solutions. In the past, IR transparent materials like inorganic ceramic, glass, and sulfur-rich organic materials were typically processed through slower, more cumbersome thermal or mechanical processes. This system addresses that problem by offering a faster, more convenient alternative with the potential to significantly elevate the standards in the production and application of IR optics. Applications include space exploration, optical solutions, compact IR imaging systems, and construction of micro-reactors for temperature monitoring. Advantages include providing a broad spectrum of transparency, boosting production speed and efficiency compared to traditional thermal or mechanical methods, enabling the production of high-resolution IR optics, streamlining the construction of micro-reactors for temperature monitoring, and presenting a versatile solution applicable to a diverse range of fields.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention introduces a UV-curable Thiol-ene system designed for producing infrared (IR) transparent materials using a combination of multithiols and divinyl oligomers. It offers broad-spectrum transparency from visible light to long-wave IR (LWIR) while enhancing production speed and efficiency compared to traditional methods.

**Applications:** Key applications include space exploration, optical solutions, compact IR imaging systems, and the construction of micro-reactors for temperature monitoring.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the slow and cumbersome processing of traditional IR transparent materials by providing a faster and more convenient alternative, significantly improving the production and application standards of IR optics.
llm_teaser: Unlock the future of infrared technology with our groundbreaking UV-curable Thiol-ene system, revolutionizing the production of transparent materials that seamlessly bridge the gap from visible light to long-wave IR, enhancing efficiency and opening new frontiers in space exploration and advanced optical solutions.

ip_name: Dermoscopy Performance and Educational Phone Application
ip_description: This invention is a dermoscopy phone app for dermatologists and clinicians that tracks diagnostic accuracy of skin biopsies obtained on dermoscope. The app will allow users to review their personal image library and utilize built-in app statistics to identify areas for improvement. Dermatopathologists reviewing the histology slides will have the opportunity to review the dermoscopy photos, which would provide valuable clinicopathologic correlation that could facilitate the interpretation of the pathology report. The app will have built-in statistics to identify core competencies for improvement as it will track findings obtained from dermatopathologists’ review of the histology slides relative to dermoscope image. The software will also allow physicians/clinicians to review their personal image library. **Summary:** This technology is a dermoscopy phone app designed for dermatologists and clinicians that tracks the diagnostic accuracy of skin biopsies obtained via dermoscope.
