The invention describes different random patterns for projection and an adaptive or “smart” algorithm to change the patterns in real-time to improve accuracy of the measurement process. The projected patterns can be modified in real-time to improve sampling of local areas where there are large changes and high background noise. Structured light illumination is used extensively in 3D imaging to measure topography of an object. Conventional methods utilize periodic fringe pattern of different phase to reconstruct the surface shape of an object. Different periodic fringes are projected onto the object sequentially and the reflected fringes are measured at different times. A minimum of three sets of fringes are needed for reconstruction and more fringes are often used to improve accuracy. When the different fringes are projected at the same time, the camera cannot identify and separate the different fringes. The measurement technique is limited by the time to project and to measure accurately the different fringe patterns and cannot be applied to rapidly changing or moving objects.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention enhances 3D imaging systems by utilizing random multi-spectral and polarization structured light illumination, allowing for simultaneous measurement of reflected patterns. It employs adaptive algorithms to modify projection patterns in real-time, improving accuracy and acquisition speed, particularly in dynamic environments.

**Applications:** Key use cases include advanced 3D imaging for topography measurement, applications in robotics, and real-time analysis in rapidly changing scenes.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the limitations of conventional sequential measurement techniques, enabling accurate 3D reconstruction of objects without the time constraints associated with projecting and measuring multiple fringe patterns.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing 3D imaging, this groundbreaking technology captures intricate details in a single shot by harnessing random multi-spectral and polarization patterns, dramatically enhancing accuracy and speed even in dynamic environments.

ip_name: Fecal Containment Obstetric Drape
ip_description: This technology is an obstetric under-buttocks drape that has an additional flap located above the fluid collection portion for use during labor and delivery in childbirth. This is a one-size-fits-all flap that has an adhesive lining at the top, allowing for adhesion to the patient’s perineum and across the patient’s back thighs. The flap will not interfere with the delivery of the infant as it is located inferior to the vaginal introitus. This will create a sealed barrier between the sterile field and any defecation so that the infant will not encounter fecal matter. Providers can then focus on supporting the patient through the pushing process instead of wiping up fecal matter and disposing of it to reestablish a sterile area. If necessary, the flap can be easily removed to expose the anus. Bowel movements are common during the second stage of labor due to the muscles utilized during pushing the infant down the birth canal. The embarrassment from the bowel movements often distracts or causes added stress for the patient during childbirth. The nurses and providers also are continuously using and disposing of resources to clean the patient in order to alleviate stress and maintain a sterile environment for the infant. It is standard for a sterile under-buttocks drape to be present during childbirth. However, it only addresses the collection of blood and other fluids expelled during vaginal delivery. Applications: Childbirth, Medical procedures where defecation could occur. Advantages: Easier for providers to establish sterile area, Simple to use, Does not interfere with delivery of the infant, Separate barrier between sterile and soiled fields, Reduces potential embarrassment and stress for the patient.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Fecal Containment Obstetric Drape is a one-size-fits-all under-buttocks drape designed for use during labor and delivery, featuring an adhesive flap that creates a sealed barrier to prevent fecal matter from contaminating the sterile field. This innovation allows healthcare providers to focus on supporting the patient without the distraction of cleaning up during childbirth.

**Applications:** Childbirth, medical procedures where defecation could occur.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the common occurrence of bowel movements during the second stage of labor, reducing embarrassment and stress for the patient while maintaining a sterile environment for the infant.
llm_teaser: Introducing the Fecal Containment Obstetric Drape: a revolutionary solution that creates a seamless barrier during childbirth, allowing healthcare providers to maintain a sterile environment while minimizing patient embarrassment and stress, ensuring a focused and supportive delivery experience.

ip_name: Aquabot - Marine Drones/Bots - Device, Method and System
ip_description: This invention is a range of aquatic vessels designed as “drones” or “bots” capable of individual or collective action for water monitoring, collection of materials, or discharge of contents. As a system, these devices may be operated in an unmanned autonomous fashion or via remote control, or a hybrid of the two. Drones may function as a swarm or armada, for either “diagnostic” or “therapeutic” purposes. As diagnostic devices, they will have means of sensing, recording, and telemetered data which may be stored onboard or remotely, processed, and analyzed, and displayed to create maps or other graphic depictions of regional or global conditions. As therapeutic devices, drones are capable of material scavenging and removal, e.g., sea plastics, or of the release of mitigating agents or materials. Oceans and water bodies have vital roles in transporting goods as well as guiding and maintaining the environmental health of the planet. It is essential to guard and protect water to preserve its functionality, purity, and availability as it is such a fundamental component of all life. However, with increasing human population, there is an increase in waste that ends up in bodies of water. Although there are many waste collection and removal devices for water bodies, they either require human supervision or work autonomously.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Aquabot is a versatile range of aquatic drones designed for water monitoring, material collection, and content discharge, operable autonomously, remotely, or in a hybrid mode. These devices can function individually or as a swarm, equipped with diagnostic capabilities for data sensing and analysis, as well as therapeutic functions for material scavenging and pollutant mitigation.

**Applications:** Key use cases include environmental monitoring, waste collection in aquatic environments, and the management of water quality through the release of mitigating agents.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the increasing issue of waste accumulation in water bodies due to rising human populations, providing a solution that reduces the need for human supervision in waste collection and environmental protection efforts.
llm_teaser: "Introducing Aquabot: the revolutionary marine drones that autonomously monitor, collect, and cleanse our oceans, transforming water conservation into a coordinated, intelligent effort for a healthier planet."

ip_name: Polarization Application for Optical Sorting Machines
ip_description: This software solution combines state-of-the-art polarization imaging with advanced post-processing and machine vision technology to improve optical sorting in recycling and waste management industries. By using polarized light and advanced algorithms, this innovative approach offers a faster, more accurate, and cost-effective alternative to conventional methods, optimizing recycling processes and ensuring consistently high-quality recycled materials. In an increasingly eco-conscious world, efficient and accurate material sorting is essential for recycling and waste management industries. Current optical sorting technologies, while effective, face limitations in identifying and classifying materials that are similar in appearance or challenging to detect. Applications include sorting and identification in industrial applications. Advantages include reduced sensitivity to ambient light, enhanced material discrimination, faster processing, more accuracy, and cost-effectiveness.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This software solution utilizes advanced polarization imaging and machine vision technology to enhance optical sorting in recycling and waste management. It offers a faster, more accurate, and cost-effective alternative to traditional methods by improving material discrimination and reducing sensitivity to ambient light.

**Applications:** Key use cases include recycling and waste management industries, as well as sorting and identification in various industrial applications.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses limitations in current optical sorting methods, particularly in identifying and classifying materials that are visually similar or difficult to detect, thereby optimizing recycling processes and improving the quality of recycled materials.
llm_teaser: Revolutionize recycling with our cutting-edge Polarization Application, leveraging advanced imaging and algorithms to deliver unparalleled accuracy and speed in optical sorting, ensuring high-quality recycled materials while reducing costs and environmental impact.

ip_name: TROVE: A Translational Resource for Omics-Based Validation of Expression Datasets
ip_description: Translational Resource for Omics-Based Validation of Expression (TROVE) is a solution-oriented query-able disease database that integrates various -omic data from animals and humans, reflective of the One Health paradigm. The innovation is focused on dataset integration and identification, to immediately provide targeted solutions for identified infection/immunity pathogens. This technology is also able to interface with R Bioconductor package making it simple to create data visuals for the datasets. Currently there are few infectious disease databases that incorporate the advancements made in understanding the similarities between animals and humans and the impact we have on each other. This is the direction most pathogen research is heading towards as One Health becomes an increasingly popular way of thinking. Applications include Database and Translational research. Advantages include Targeted solutions and One Health perspective.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** TROVE is a query-able disease database that integrates diverse omic data from both animals and humans, promoting a One Health perspective. It facilitates dataset integration and identification, providing targeted solutions for infection and immunity-related pathogens, and interfaces with the R Bioconductor package for data visualization.

**Applications:** The primary use cases include database management and translational research in infectious diseases, particularly those that highlight the interconnections between human and animal health.

**Problem Solved:** TROVE addresses the lack of comprehensive infectious disease databases that reflect the advancements in understanding the relationships between animal and human health, aligning with the growing emphasis on the One Health approach in pathogen research.
llm_teaser: Unlock the power of TROVE, the groundbreaking database that seamlessly integrates omics data from humans and animals to deliver targeted solutions for infectious diseases, revolutionizing research through a One Health approach.

ip_name: Method and System for Optical Transmission and Crosstalk Reduction in LIDAR using Polarized Light
ip_description: This invention has been developed to enhance encoding methods for information transmission and to reduce crosstalk in LiDAR applications by utilizing polarized light. Instead of using binary encoding methods such as frequency resolved optical gating and on-off keying, this invention encodes vital information into the polarization state of the light pulse. This new approach decreases measurement error by generating a key code that uniquely identifies a transmitter and receiver pair. The invention also leverages the diattenuation and retardance of birefringent objects to modify the polarization state of the reflected light pulse. To distinguish these changes, the transmitted light pulse can be duplicated or sent in triplicate pairs, and the modifications in the polarization state can be detected by the receiver. Conventional LiDAR devices rely on the reflectance of the object, and objects with high absorption and light scattering tend to reflect less light back to the receiver. This innovative approach improves on this limitation by considering the diattenuation and retardance of birefringent objects, which can alter the polarization state of the light pulse. By using polarized light and encoding key information into the polarization state of the light pulse, the signal to noise ratio can be improved, and crosstalk can be minimized.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention enhances LiDAR technology by using polarized light to encode information, reducing crosstalk and measurement errors. It employs the diattenuation and retardance of birefringent objects to modify the polarization state of reflected light pulses, improving signal quality and identification of transmitter-receiver pairs.

**Applications:** The technology is applicable in advanced LiDAR systems, autonomous vehicles, and remote sensing industries, where accurate distance measurement and object detection are crucial.

**Problem Solved:** The invention addresses the limitations of conventional LiDAR devices that struggle with high absorption and light scattering, leading to reduced reflectance. By utilizing polarized light, it enhances the signal-to-noise ratio and minimizes crosstalk, improving overall performance.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing LiDAR technology, this innovative method harnesses polarized light to encode information and drastically reduce crosstalk, enhancing signal clarity and measurement accuracy even in challenging environments.

ip_name: Phase Modulated Camera
ip_description: This invention provides a method to image though a disruptive media, such as fog, rain, snow, and sand particles. The phase-based camera, coupled with existing cameras and sensors normally equipped on autonomous vehicles, allows for detection and viewing objects through fog, smoke, or other atmospheric obstructions. The system consists of a lens, phase light modulation (PLM) device, 2-dimension detector array such as complementary metal-oxide semiconductor (CMOS) imager and a light source, such as a collimated laser, which illuminates the object. Return signal from an object—for example, a car in fog—is captured by camera with a PLM which is situated in the optical path between the camera lens and 2-dimentional detector array. In the system, two or more images are captured by camera while displaying phase and/or amplitude profiles which are orthogonal with each other. The images are subtracted to eliminate background and deconvolved to enhance the feature inside the fog or other disruptive media. Camera-based object recognition and autonomous driving based on the information is one of the critical functions for Advanced Driver Assistant System (ADAS) for automotives. Camera-based ADAS is not only applicable for ground-based mobility, but also for mobility in air. Recently, Amazon announced “Amazon Prime Air,” which are FAA-approved delivery drones that carry packages while the drones are autonomously navigated by camera. All such mobility infrastructures rely upon situational awareness by camera, and other means such as radar and LIDAR. One of the common challenges in situation awareness for urban mobility as an infrastructure is robustness to inclement weather conditions, such as fog, rain, and snow. The camera-based situation awareness does not work well in such conditions. In contrast, the radar can see through fog since the wavelength is much longer compared to the length scale of fog and rainwater particles. However, known challenges include resolution and signal contrast. This technology offers radar-like capability with the resolution of an optical camera.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention introduces a phase modulated camera that enables imaging through disruptive media such as fog, rain, and snow. It combines a phase light modulation device with existing camera systems to enhance object detection and recognition, providing radar-like capabilities with the resolution of an optical camera.

**Applications:** Key applications include advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) for automotive vehicles and autonomous navigation for delivery drones, such as those used by Amazon Prime Air.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of situational awareness in urban mobility under adverse weather conditions, where traditional camera-based systems struggle to function effectively.
llm_teaser: "Unlock unparalleled visibility in adverse weather conditions with the Phase Modulated Camera, a groundbreaking technology that combines advanced phase light modulation with optical imaging to detect and recognize objects through fog, rain, and snow, ensuring safe navigation for autonomous vehicles and drones."

ip_name: Multifunctional Nanofiber Reinforcement for Printable Electronics
ip_description: Researchers at the University of Arizona have integrated electrospun nanofibers into printable optoelectronic films to improve their stability and toughness. These nanofibers have the potential for improved efficiency in solar cells through light scattering. Recent advances in the solar cell industry have led to the development of more efficient construction materials for solar cells. Perovskite-based solar cells have been competing with the best silicon-based photovoltaics due to their ability to exhibit greater efficiency than silicon-based ones. Even though Perovskite based cells have greater efficiency that silicon-based ones, the cells still require improvements in both their thermomechanical and chemical stability required to achieve the Department of Energy SunShot goal of a $0.02−0.03 kWh−1 LCOE by 2030. This invention aims to solve the problem by inserting nanofiber reinforcements into the cells to improve the stability of the Perovskite solar cell without sacrificing either efficiency or compatibility with the solar cell applications.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** Researchers at the University of Arizona have developed a technology that integrates electrospun nanofibers into printable optoelectronic films, enhancing the stability and toughness of Perovskite solar cells. This innovation aims to improve the efficiency of solar cells through light scattering while maintaining compatibility with existing solar cell applications.

**Applications:** This technology can be utilized in the solar energy industry, particularly in the development of Perovskite-based solar cells, as well as in the production of printable electronics.

**Problem Solved:** The invention addresses the need for improved thermomechanical and chemical stability in Perovskite solar cells, which is essential to meet the Department of Energy's SunShot goal for cost-effective solar energy by 2030.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing solar technology, researchers at the University of Arizona have developed a groundbreaking method to enhance the stability and efficiency of Perovskite solar cells by integrating multifunctional nanofiber reinforcements into printable optoelectronic films."

ip_name: Method and Device for 3D Imaging and Imaging through Scattering Scenes
ip_description:
This invention describes a method to create a computational camera that can image through dynamic scattering media with high resolution. The camera can create a synthetic hologram by combining light at two closely spaced optical frequencies to produce a low-frequency synthetic wave (beat wave), largely immune to the unknown scattering processes between the hidden scene and detector. This is primarily proposed for medical imaging applications through living tissue. This noninvasive technique only uses light in the optical wave band and works with standard off-the-shelf camera technology– potentially even with mobile phone camera sensors, leveraging the huge potential of carefully designed optical systems paired with sophisticated algorithms.

The plan to develop such a camera needs a Synthetic Wavelength Holography (SWH) to image through scattering media and around corners with a demonstrated resolution of up to 800μm. However, the current SWH approach relies on the acquisition of sequentially captured images and is extremely susceptible to motion, making imaging through living tissue impossible with the current method. The current SWH technique also relies on expensive modulation/imaging hardware. The plan found its solution from the spatial heterodyning procedure, which allows for single-shot SWH measurements with the same or similar quality. This means that all required information can be captured with one single camera image in a very short exposure time. Moreover, this approach only requires the standard off-the-shelf camera technology that can be found in every smartphone instead of expensive modulation/imaging hardware. If successful, the camera could become part of a new wave of computational imaging devices that will represent key technologies in the near future.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention presents a method for creating a computational camera capable of high-resolution imaging through dynamic scattering media, utilizing a synthetic hologram generated by combining light at closely spaced optical frequencies. The approach enables single-shot imaging with standard off-the-shelf camera technology, including mobile phone sensors, while achieving a resolution of up to 800μm.

**Applications:** The primary application is in medical imaging through living tissue, but the technology could also extend to other fields requiring imaging through scattering environments.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the limitations of current Synthetic Wavelength Holography methods, which are hindered by motion sensitivity and the need for expensive hardware, by enabling noninvasive imaging with a single camera image and short exposure times.
llm_teaser: Unlock the future of medical imaging with a revolutionary computational camera that captures high-resolution images through dynamic scattering media in a single shot, using only standard smartphone technology to noninvasively visualize living tissue like never before.

ip_name: Small Molecules with Antifungal Activity for Cryptococcosis
ip_description: Researchers at the University of Arizona have found 140 novel antifungal compounds with the potential to treat cryptococcosis. These compounds have anti-Cryptococcus neoformans activity with IC50 less than 10 uM. Fungal infections, although not very contagious, have affected 300 million people worldwide. Cryptococcosis is caused by opportunistic fungal pathogens Cryptococcus neoformans (Cne) and Cryptococcus gattii (Cga). Immunocompromised individuals are the most affected. Approximately 223,100 human patients are affected by cryptococcosis meningitis globally, with 180,000 deaths annually. Cne and Cga initially affect lungs and in severe condition the brain leading to meningitis. Currently AmphotericinB alone or in combination with 5-Fc is used to treat cryptococcosis infections, however drug resistance is on the rise and there is a need for antifungal drug development. Applications include medical treatment of fungal infections, plant treatments for fungal infections, and animal treatments for fungal infections. Advantages include a wide range of compounds and the fact that fungi are not yet resistant to these compounds.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** Researchers at the University of Arizona have discovered 140 novel antifungal compounds that exhibit anti-Cryptococcus neoformans activity with IC50 values less than 10 uM. These compounds show promise in treating cryptococcosis, particularly in immunocompromised individuals, and are not yet subject to fungal resistance.

**Applications:** The main use cases include medical treatments for fungal infections in humans, as well as potential applications in treating fungal infections in plants and animals.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the growing issue of drug resistance in current antifungal treatments for cryptococcosis, providing new options for effective therapy against this serious infection.
llm_teaser: "Unlocking a new frontier in antifungal therapy, researchers at the University of Arizona have discovered 140 innovative small molecules that effectively combat cryptococcosis, offering hope against rising drug resistance and saving countless lives worldwide."

ip_name: Plasma from Mouse Stroke Model that can be used to detect Neurofilament Light Chain
ip_description: This invention relates to the intellectual property that consists of a stored archive of hundreds of mouse blood plasma samples that were taken from a laboratory stroke model for mice under various conditions of the mice age and the time past stroke. By evaluating the quantity of neurofilament light (NfL) chain (protein) within the samples they can serve as an indication of neurological damage. These indicators can then be used to develop correlations and calibrations to other measurements or assay methods of neurological damage post-stroke. Neurofilament Light chain (NfL) is a neuronal protein released from cells which have sustained damage in neurological disorders, one of which is stroke. After studying stroke in a laboratory mouse model, the inventors have collected and archived hundreds of plasma samples from mouse blood under various conditions. Once these samples have been obtained, they may be used to determine whether an assay that quantify these NfL levels in human plasma may also be used to detect NfL in mouse plasma. When comparing the NfL levels in mice, there is the possibility of this assay detecting age-related neurodegeneration as well as validating the kit that can detect stroke-related neurodegeneration. Applications include a novel immunoassay for stroke detection and a novel immunoassay for neurodegenerative diseases. Advantages include being a diagnostic tool for strokes and other neurodegenerative diseases and can be used as a predictive biomarker for strokes.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology transfer listing describes a collection of mouse blood plasma samples from a stroke model, which can be analyzed for neurofilament light chain (NfL) levels to indicate neurological damage. The archived samples enable the development of assays to detect NfL in both mouse and human plasma, potentially serving as diagnostic tools for stroke and neurodegenerative diseases.

**Applications:** Key applications include the development of immunoassays for stroke detection and neurodegenerative diseases, as well as the use of NfL levels as predictive biomarkers for strokes.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the need for reliable diagnostic tools for assessing neurological damage post-stroke and offers a method for detecting age-related neurodegeneration.
llm_teaser: Unlock the potential of early stroke detection and neurodegeneration diagnosis with our groundbreaking plasma assay, leveraging a comprehensive archive of mouse blood samples to accurately quantify neurofilament light chain levels as predictive biomarkers for neurological damage.

ip_name: Advancing Utilization of Swarms for Sample Return and Multipoint Observation Using Inflatables
ip_description: This technology is a system and method for an attachment to a mothership/craft or “bus” that uses space or ground-based inflatable structures to capture entire swarms of autonomous spacecraft, air, or unmanned aerial system (UAS) drones. A bell flower-like geometry is used for its ability to capture an incoming vehicle with randomized conditions and trajectories due to running out of fuel or damage to propulsion or guidance, navigation, and control (GNC) systems. Inflatable systems have widespread applications in the aerospace and astronautics industries as habitats, atmospheric decelerators, debris capture systems, and methods of satellite dispersion from a mothership. Using inflatables for the purpose of capturing or retrieving swarms of air/spacecraft is an innovative implementation of available technology which has the capability to outperform many of the current methods like tethers and solid docking stations. The markets for CubeSats, microsatellites, deep space exploration, space robotics, drones, and swarm intelligence are forecasted to see moderate to high levels of growth in the 2020s. Given the proximity of this innovation to these markets, stable short-term demand can be expected. There is currently no mainstream industry standard for retrieving swarms of air/spacecraft to a mothership, so the competition may be fierce, but end-users are limited in their options.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology involves a system that utilizes inflatable structures to capture swarms of autonomous spacecraft or drones, employing a bell flower-like geometry to accommodate various incoming conditions. It offers an innovative alternative to traditional methods like tethers and solid docking stations, with potential for high performance in retrieval operations.

**Applications:** The technology has applications in aerospace and astronautics, including habitats, atmospheric decelerators, debris capture systems, and satellite dispersion. It is also relevant to markets such as CubeSats, microsatellites, deep space exploration, space robotics, drones, and swarm intelligence.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the lack of mainstream industry standards for retrieving swarms of air and spacecraft to a mothership, providing a more effective solution compared to existing methods. It aims to enhance the efficiency and reliability of capturing autonomous vehicles that may experience propulsion or guidance failures.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing swarm retrieval, our inflatable capture system seamlessly adapts to unpredictable conditions, ensuring safe and efficient recovery of autonomous drones and spacecraft, paving the way for unprecedented advancements in aerospace exploration and satellite deployment."

ip_name: Treating or Preventing Anorexia Nervosa via Precision Targeting of Neuronal Circuit
ip_description: This invention provides methods of treating one or more eating disorders, including anorexia nervosa, bulimia, and related clinical syndromes. A new treatment strategy has been discovered, which inhibits two different neural circuits, which rescues all three of the activity-based anorexia (ABA) animal model phenotypes of extreme increases in wheel activity, decreases in food intake, and consequently, life-threatening loss in body weight. Methods of administration for a therapeutic may include electric brain stimulation and/or pharmacological inhibitors of specific protein expression. Anorexia nervosa (AN) is a prevalent eating disorder seen primarily in females, which significantly disrupts life and health, to the point of reaching fatality in extreme cases, with the highest mortality rate of any psychiatric disorder. AN is characterized by self-starvation, fear of gaining weight, and excessive exercise, but also is often co-diagnosed with other psychiatric and emotional disorders, such as depression, anxiety, and obsessive compulsive disorder. These characteristics of AN suggest the neural circuits regulating eating behavior and the neural circuits regulating emotion interact extensively and significantly to control AN development. However, studies of single neural pathways show that the underlying neural mechanisms involved in AN, particularly how neurons in the amygdala regulate the development remain to be determined. There remains an urgent need for an effective intervention strategy in treating eating disorders. Applications: Treatments for anorexia nervosa, bulimia, and related syndromes; Biological target for drug discovery. Advantages: Specific biological targeting of neuronal pathways regulating eating disorders; Opportunity for direct device and/or pharmacological intervention; Attractive results from animal tests.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention presents a novel treatment method for eating disorders, particularly anorexia nervosa, by inhibiting specific neural circuits. The approach has shown promising results in animal models, addressing extreme behaviors associated with the disorder, such as increased activity and reduced food intake.

**Applications:** Treatments for anorexia nervosa, bulimia, and related clinical syndromes; potential biological target for drug discovery.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the urgent need for effective interventions for eating disorders, which have high mortality rates and significantly disrupt health and quality of life.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing the fight against anorexia nervosa, this groundbreaking technology precisely targets and inhibits key neuronal circuits to restore healthy eating behaviors and emotional balance, offering hope for effective treatment where traditional methods have failed.

ip_name: Virtual Reality Neuropsychological Assessment (VRNA) System
ip_description: This technology is a computerized neuropsychological assessment system to rapidly measure cognitive and behavioral abilities and impairments. This system operates by extracting multiple, simultaneous performance metrics while the patient is in a virtual reality (VR) game-like scenario. As the patient is playing this challenging VR video game, the VRNA System integrates inputs from multiple sensors with machine learning analysis. These inputs assess the various domains of real-time cognitive performance to provide a rapid, personalized assessment of neurocognitive status. This innovation assists in the immediate assessment of cognitive performance metrics. This rapid assessment of cognitive status is not only personalized but provides AI-based neuro-psych evaluations for traumatic brain injury (TBI) and sports-related fields. This assessment can be performed as soon as possible instead of depending on transportation to other locations. Applications include mobile rapid neuropsychological assessment, monitoring of neurological effects of combat, monitoring of PTSD, and neuro-psych evaluations for traumatic brain injury and sports-related fields. Advantages include the ability to be used for PTSD assessment in non-veteran patients, personalized assessment, rapid assessment results, and portability for on-site performance.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The Virtual Reality Neuropsychological Assessment (VRNA) System is a computerized tool that rapidly measures cognitive and behavioral abilities through a VR game-like scenario, utilizing multiple sensors and machine learning for real-time analysis. It provides personalized, AI-based neuropsych evaluations, particularly for traumatic brain injury (TBI) and sports-related assessments.

**Applications:** Key applications include mobile rapid neuropsychological assessments, monitoring neurological effects of combat, and evaluations for PTSD and sports-related injuries.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the need for immediate and portable cognitive performance assessments, eliminating delays associated with transportation to traditional assessment locations.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing cognitive evaluation, the Virtual Reality Neuropsychological Assessment (VRNA) System delivers rapid, personalized insights into neurocognitive status through immersive gaming experiences, enabling immediate assessments for traumatic brain injury, PTSD, and more—anytime, anywhere."

ip_name: Sequential Control of Electromagnets for CubeSat Docking Attitude Alignment
ip_description: The technology is a new method of sequential control of electromagnets in the application of autonomous docking using two CubeSat (miniature satellites). This is done with the help of active illumination signals through LED lights that are installed on two different CubeSats which helps for target identification in both CubeSats. Once the target identification process is done, the runner CubeSat and the chaser CubeSat start to move closer to each other with their propulsion. After the two CubeSats are close enough to each other the lights turn off and a two-step process starts to dock the two CubeSats. The first step is to deploy of an inflated balloon structure, and the second step involves turning the electromagnets. Autonomous docking is an important part of spacecraft innovation. It makes possible for spacecrafts to link together, which can allow for in-space assembly and on-orbit servicing. Current docking spacecraft docking methods are more prone to cause collisions and subsequent failures during the rendezvous and proximity operations. The invention proposes using electromagnetic levitations as it has been proved to be one of the safest approaches for autonomous docking. The main goal of the technology is to have two spacecrafts to dock with each other using the electromagnetic levitation method by using the onboard systems which will also enable a minimal use of active thrusters and fuel. Applications include autonomous docking for spacecrafts, formation flying, surveillance, security, and fault detection for smaller non-contact docking. Advantages include more freedom of error in the docking error, reduced change of leakage problems, and a safer approach for docking spacecrafts.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The technology introduces a sequential control method for electromagnets to facilitate autonomous docking between two CubeSats using active LED illumination for target identification. It employs a two-step docking process involving an inflated balloon structure and electromagnet activation, aiming to enhance safety and reduce fuel consumption during the docking operation.

**Applications:** Key use cases include autonomous docking for spacecraft, formation flying, and surveillance. It can also be applied in security and fault detection for smaller non-contact docking scenarios.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the risks associated with current spacecraft docking methods, which are prone to collisions and failures during rendezvous operations, by utilizing electromagnetic levitation for a safer docking approach.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing autonomous spacecraft docking, this innovative technology harnesses sequential control of electromagnets and active LED illumination to ensure precise, collision-free alignment and connection between CubeSats, paving the way for safer in-space assembly and servicing.

ip_name: Distributed Computer Processing Networks for Lunar Bases and Space Stations
ip_description: This invention comprises systems and methods for a hyper-redundant distributed computing and communication network that can permeate base infrastructures and heal from local damage. Modular components are used to collect, process, store, and communicate information in a distributed fashion. The networks can make localized decisions independently and offload routine maintenance responsibilities from astronauts, improving the efficiency of base operations and overall safety. This software can be implemented as a control architecture and ecosystem for smart bases (military, army, commercial, etc.), space stations, Moon/Mars bases, and smart infrastructure. Hyper-redundancy in distributed computing networks extend the degrees of operational freedom to a large or infinite degree of redundancy. The use of these systems in smart bases, space stations, Moon/Mars bases, and smart infrastructure will improve efficiency, safeguard crews and systems, and help to enable the next generation of orbital habitats and extraterrestrial bases while simultaneously improving the quality of life on Earth through optimized resource management, detailed information collection, and autonomous decision making. This system is further reinforced with self-healing capabilities to address extreme space conditions, such as solar flares and high-energy particles. These self-healing systems are used to autonomously repair software or reorganize resource usage around damaged systems. Most of the market for smart networks in applications like the Internet of Things (IoT), Battlefield of Things (BoT), etc. remains on Earth, but there is an increasing demand for related networks in space, on the Moon, and on Mars. Smart infrastructure and space tourism are expected to exhibit large compound annual growth rates, while smart infrastructure and deep space exploration/technology are currently two of the largest relevant markets. Applications: Software for use as a control architecture and ecosystem in smart bases, space stations, and smart infrastructure. Advantages: Hyper-redundant, Improves overall safety, Heals from local damage, Permeates infrastructures, Improves efficiency of base operations.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention features a hyper-redundant distributed computing and communication network designed for lunar bases, space stations, and smart infrastructures. It utilizes modular components to autonomously collect, process, and communicate information, enhancing operational efficiency and safety while providing self-healing capabilities to withstand extreme space conditions.

**Applications:** The technology can be implemented in smart bases, military and commercial operations, space stations, and extraterrestrial bases on the Moon and Mars. It is also relevant for smart infrastructure and the Internet of Things (IoT).

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the challenges of maintaining efficient operations and safety in extreme environments by enabling localized decision-making and self-repair capabilities, thereby reducing the burden on astronauts and improving resource management.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing extraterrestrial living, our hyper-redundant distributed computing networks empower lunar bases and space stations with self-healing capabilities, ensuring unparalleled efficiency, safety, and autonomy in the harshest environments of space."

ip_name: Neonatal Anorectal Tonometer with Disposable/Detachable Tip
ip_description:
This technology is a neonatal anorectal tonometer that involves a detachable, fluid-filled tip with a quick release system involving (magnet & plate) that connects the tip to a force sensor inside the handle of the device. This device can be used as a substitute for digital rectal exams.

Background: Cauda Equina Syndrome (CES) occurs when the Cauda Equina nerve fibers become irritated by pressure or inflammation. The treatment for Cauda Equina is immediate surgical intervention. The absence or reduction of rectal tone is used in the diagnosis of several neurological conditions including CES. This invention describes a neonatal anorectal tonometer, intended to measure rectal tone in adults and newborns caused by CES.

Applications:
*   Routine diagnostic tool
*   Intra-operative monitor as real-time feedback of delicate surgery progression
*   Research
*   Wide variety of nerve conditions can benefit from this portfolio of applications

Advantages:
*   Quantitative measurement of rectal tone allows for better comparison and treatment
*   Faster and easier evaluations save time for diagnosticians and increase testing access
*   Increased accuracy through use of a systematic tool and minimizes subjective inspection
*   Consistent results independent of examiner behavior and universally applicable data
llm_summary:
**Summary:** The neonatal anorectal tonometer features a detachable, fluid-filled tip with a quick release system that connects to a force sensor, allowing it to serve as a substitute for digital rectal exams. It provides quantitative measurements of rectal tone, enhancing diagnostic accuracy and efficiency.

**Applications:** This device can be used as a routine diagnostic tool, an intra-operative monitor for real-time feedback during surgery, and in research related to various nerve conditions.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the need for accurate measurement of rectal tone, which is crucial for diagnosing conditions like Cauda Equina Syndrome, thereby facilitating timely surgical intervention and improving patient outcomes.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing neonatal care, the Neonatal Anorectal Tonometer offers precise, quantitative measurements of rectal tone with a unique detachable tip, streamlining diagnostics and enhancing treatment accuracy for critical nerve conditions like Cauda Equina Syndrome.

ip_name: Compact, Lightweight Counter for Atmospheric Cloud Condensation Nuclei and Condensation Nuclei
ip_description:
This technology details a lightweight integrated analysis instrument for dual use to directly sample, analyze, and count atmospheric cloud condensation nuclei and/or condensation nuclei. The instrument can be operated in dual modes:  as a Cloud Condensation Nucleus Counter (CCNC) and as a Condensation Nucleus Counter (CNC). An integrated prototype fits in a portable, lightweight bag, and directly draws in atmospheric samples into an analysis chamber to count either cloud condensation nuclei or condensation nuclei, depending on this setting is selected. Measurements are then displayed and recorded in real time.

The United Nations Committee on Climate Change has repeatedly said that clouds and aerosols are the biggest unknowns in the Greenhouse Warming estimates. Due to the potential low cost, this technology might enable the operation of thousands of aerosols monitoring stations rather than perhaps the few hundred that are currently available. Cloud condensation nuclei (CCNs) are atmospheric particles that absorb water in the presence of supersaturated water vapor and grow, or activate, to form cloud droplets or an ice particle. The CCN can be the size of about 0.1 micron up to 1 mm, or about 1/100 the size of a cloud droplet.

In addition to atmospheric clouds and aerosols, the invention can measure condensation nuclei (CNs), which are tiny aerosol particles (which may range in size from 1 Angstrom up to 0.1 micron). CNCs may be useful in the areas of indoor air monitoring, cleanrooms, and personal health monitoring.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology features a compact and lightweight instrument capable of sampling, analyzing, and counting atmospheric cloud condensation nuclei (CCN) and condensation nuclei (CN) in real time. It operates in dual modes as a Cloud Condensation Nucleus Counter (CCNC) and a Condensation Nucleus Counter (CNC), all within a portable design.

**Applications:** The technology can be used in atmospheric monitoring, indoor air quality assessment, cleanroom environments, and personal health monitoring.

**Problem Solved:** This instrument addresses the need for more extensive monitoring of aerosols and clouds, which are significant uncertainties in greenhouse warming estimates, potentially enabling the establishment of thousands of monitoring stations at a low cost.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing atmospheric science, this compact and lightweight dual-mode counter empowers real-time monitoring of cloud and condensation nuclei, potentially transforming our understanding of climate dynamics by enabling widespread aerosol observation at an unprecedented scale.

ip_name: Peptide Therapeutic for Immune Response Activation against Metastatic Triple Negative Breast Cancer
ip_description: This invention provides compositions and methods for treating triple negative breast cancer using peptides or peptide mimics that bind to epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) to block EGFR nuclear translocation. This mode of action alters EGFR-dependent gene transcription, induces the loss of cancer cell survival and migratory capacity, and induces tumor regression. This therapeutic induces cell death in wildtype EGFR-expressing cancer cells, but not normal epithelium. Efficacy experiments in a mouse model for EGFR-dependent breast cancer resulted in significant tumor regression without observable toxicity. In addition, this compound activates the immune system, exhibited by cytotoxic T lymphocytes and natural killer cells activity in the immune microenvironment, and a prognostically favorable macrophage M1/M2 ratio. Target disease indications are breast cancer, particularly triple-negative breast cancer, as well as other cancer types in which EGFR is implicated. Toxicology tests in a mouse model show favorable results. Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) has long been in need of therapies that are both effective and targeted. Current drugs for TNBC such as monoclonal antibodies and PARP inhibitors have limited effectiveness and serious side effects such as nausea, fatigue, decreased white blood cell count, anemia, and upper respiratory tract infection. This invention holds the promise to make treatment of TNBC possible for more people and more effective via its unique mechanism of action, while also reducing side effects by superior targeting of the disease. Applications: Pharmacological treatment of triple-negative breast cancer, including metastatic; Therapeutic for additional EGFR-type cancers. Advantages: Effective pharmacological approach to treating triple negative breast cancer; Specific biological targeting of EGFR; Activates immune system to target cancer cells; Attractive results from animal toxicology tests.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention offers a peptide therapeutic that targets the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) to treat metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) by blocking EGFR nuclear translocation, leading to tumor regression and immune system activation. It demonstrates significant efficacy in mouse models with minimal toxicity, distinguishing it from current TNBC treatments.

**Applications:** Pharmacological treatment of triple-negative breast cancer, including metastatic cases; therapeutic use for other cancers involving EGFR.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the need for effective and targeted therapies for triple-negative breast cancer, which currently has limited treatment options and significant side effects.
llm_teaser: Unlocking a new frontier in cancer treatment, this innovative peptide therapeutic selectively targets and blocks EGFR nuclear translocation in metastatic triple-negative breast cancer, inducing tumor regression while activating the immune system and minimizing side effects.

ip_name: Method for Optimizing Test Selection based on Cost and Uncertainty
ip_description: This technology is an algorithm/method that optimizes the potential knowledge gained about a complex system when performing robustness testing with a set of constraints (cost, resources, etc.,). It can be used to optimize which test should be run based on the constraints and is particularly useful for prioritizing tests based on both the cost of each test and the uncertainty associated with the knowledge of the system being tested. Optimization algorithms have diverse applications in many industries, but this algorithm is primarily for use in defense and biopharmaceuticals. It would be ideal for companies that need to test complex products with many possible modes of configuration. The related markets are expected to see mid-to-high levels of growth before 2030 with machine learning having a large influence on market growth and technology adoption. Applications include Defense, Machine learning, Biopharmaceuticals, Software testing services, and Decision and knowledge management software. Advantages include being useful for prioritizing tests based on cost and system uncertainty, optimizing the potential knowledge gained about a complex system, and being ideal for companies that must test complex products with many configurations.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology features an algorithm that optimizes test selection for robustness testing by considering constraints such as cost and resources. It prioritizes tests based on their cost and the uncertainty of the system being tested, maximizing the knowledge gained about complex products with multiple configurations.

**Applications:** Key applications include defense, biopharmaceuticals, machine learning, software testing services, and decision and knowledge management software.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of efficiently selecting tests for complex systems by balancing cost and uncertainty, enabling companies to prioritize their testing efforts effectively.
llm_teaser: Unlock unparalleled efficiency in robustness testing with our innovative algorithm that strategically prioritizes tests based on cost and uncertainty, empowering defense and biopharmaceutical companies to maximize knowledge gain from complex systems while minimizing resource expenditure.

ip_name: Periodic Structures Embedded within Glass Mirror Substrates for Reflection to Non-Specular Directions
ip_description: This technology is a method for measuring heliostats for solar energy applications, as well as any large optical surface composed of second-surface mirrors. A small diffraction grating, which is a 1D, 2D, or 3D periodic phase and/or amplitude modulation, is embedded within the glass substrate of a second-surface mirror. Light from a metrology system propagates through this grating before and after reflection, allowing it to be directed to non-specular directions to be measured by the optical system. Multiple gratings can be written in a single layer or multiple layers in the glass to provide additional diffraction orders or more complex control of the reflected wavefronts. These gratings can enable metrology of large specular surfaces with compact optical setups, such as a point source illumination and reflection into a camera, and can also be used to re-direct a small amount of sunlight to a direction offset from the specular direction to allow measurement of the mirror orientation while it directs most sunlight to a receiver for thermal energy generation. The gratings are written with ultrafast laser pulses, with pulse duration in the femtosecond to picosecond range, to impart index of refraction variation, scattering, or both, providing phase and/or amplitude modulation. Large optomechanical structures, such as heliostats used for solar energy concentration, require sub-milliradian precision surface metrology. Due to the large size and long focal lengths of these systems, accurately measuring these surfaces with a compact metrology system is difficult. Several techniques have been developed to overcome these limitations, such as photogrammetry, which is a process of attaching components to diffusely scatter light to the heliostat mirrors; however, attaching components increases measurement uncertainty, degrades robustness, and can be time-consuming and labor-intensive. Phase gratings, which do not scatter or absorb light can be more useful for directing light differently based on wavelength, and gratings can be designed to modify the spectrum of reflected light.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology utilizes embedded diffraction gratings within glass mirror substrates to enable precise measurement of large optical surfaces, such as heliostats for solar energy applications. By directing light to non-specular directions, it allows for compact metrology setups and can modify the spectrum of reflected light.

**Applications:** Key use cases include solar energy concentration systems, large optical surface metrology, and advanced optical measurement systems.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of achieving sub-milliradian precision in measuring large specular surfaces, which is difficult with traditional methods that can introduce measurement uncertainty and require labor-intensive setups.
llm_teaser: Unlock unprecedented precision in solar energy metrology with our innovative glass-embedded diffraction gratings, enabling compact, non-specular light measurement for large optical surfaces while enhancing efficiency and reducing measurement uncertainty.

ip_name: Optical and Acoustic Coupling Materials and Technologies
ip_description: This invention describes materials and chemicals with novel, optimal optical and acoustic properties that enable or improve methods that require coupling of light and sound for biomedical and defense applications related to imaging and monitoring therapy. This invention overcomes current limitations by proposing optically and acoustically transparent gel formations, such as gellan gum. In addition, the substitution for water with “heavy water” dramatically reduces the absorption of light due to normal water. These two features not only improve on existing methods that require an efficient coupling medium for imaging, monitoring, modulation methods that use both light and sound but also enable new techniques that may not otherwise be feasible. New techniques include photoacoustic imaging and spectroscopy of lipid and water content deep into tissue. The researchers also propose novel solutions for inline photoacoustic “flashlight” adapters that co-align light and sound for optimal photoacoustic imaging—the gellan gum not only provides a stable mechanical interface, but the very low optical scattering coefficient enables shaping of the optics before it reaches the sample to be interrogated. The researchers also provide evidence that optimal coupling materials with a proper design could enable efficient optical imaging of real-time changes in function during ultrasound modulation therapy for treating a variety of medical conditions from traumatic brain injury and stroke to peripheral neuropathy. There are fundamental challenges with efficiently and optimally delivering light and (ultra)sound through coupling materials that are placed between a device that emits and/or detects light and/or sound and coalignment is often desirable. Since air is not an efficient coupling material for (ultra)sound, water-based materials that have similar acoustic properties to tissue are often used for efficient coupling. However, liquid water does not exhibit attractive mechanical properties when integrated into many devices or administered at the tissue interface. As a result, water-based and rubber-based gels are sometimes employed since they possess much better mechanical stability than water. These gels, however, have a variety of undesirable acoustic properties and/or undesirable optical properties. Ultrasound modulation is an emerging field proposed to alter the function of cells and organs; however, the mechanisms and optimal pulse encoding strategies of US modulation are poorly understood, and there are few examples where imaging techniques have been applied in real-time with ultrasound pulse sequences/sound delivery.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention introduces novel optical and acoustic coupling materials, specifically optically and acoustically transparent gel formations like gellan gum, which enhance imaging and monitoring methods in biomedical and defense applications. By substituting water with heavy water, the technology significantly reduces light absorption, enabling new techniques such as photoacoustic imaging and real-time optical imaging during ultrasound modulation therapy.

**Applications:** Key use cases include biomedical imaging, monitoring therapy for medical conditions like traumatic brain injury and stroke, and defense-related imaging technologies.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the inefficiencies of current coupling materials, which often have undesirable acoustic and optical properties, by providing a stable medium that improves light and sound coupling for enhanced imaging and therapy applications.
llm_teaser: Unlock groundbreaking advancements in biomedical imaging and therapy with our innovative optical and acoustic coupling materials that enhance light and sound integration, enabling real-time monitoring and unprecedented techniques like photoacoustic imaging deep within tissues.

ip_name: Time to Angle Sorting Camera
ip_description: This invention provides a method to sort camera-captured images based on their arrival time employing short-pulsed illumination and MEMS spatial modulator. The time-to-angle sorting method works as an add-on to commercially available cameras. Primary uses would be for driver assistance and autonomous terrestrial/aerial vehicle sensing in the detection of hidden objects under low-visibility conditions, such as fog, rain, and snow. Camera-based object recognition and autonomous driving based on information, like location, type, and velocity of objects, is one of the critical functions of Advanced Driver Assistant Systems (ADAS) for automotive. Camera-based ADAS is not only applicable for ground-based mobility but also for mobility in the air. However, all mobility infrastructures rely upon situation awareness (SA) by the camera and other means such as radar and LIDAR (Light detection and ranging). One of the common challenges in situation awareness for urban mobility as an infrastructure is robustness to low-visibility weather conditions, such as fog, rain, and snow. This invention improves visibility in those conditions by using time-stamped images with short intervals of time. Although there are studies conducted all across the world, there’s no similar product with exact abilities in the market yet. Enhancing Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) for automotive and aerial mobility platforms by improving object recognition and situational awareness. Security and surveillance applications, allowing better monitoring and detection of objects in low-visibility conditions. Add-on to commercially available cameras. Advantages include driver assistance, fog detection, increased situation awareness for urban mobility infrastructure, applicability to various weather conditions (fog, rain, snow), and compatibility with Advanced Driver Assistant Systems (ADAS).
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention introduces a time-to-angle sorting camera that enhances image sorting based on arrival time using short-pulsed illumination and a MEMS spatial modulator. It serves as an add-on to existing cameras, improving object recognition and situational awareness in low-visibility conditions.

**Applications:** The primary applications include driver assistance and autonomous vehicle sensing for both terrestrial and aerial mobility, as well as security and surveillance in challenging weather conditions.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of maintaining situational awareness in urban mobility infrastructures during low-visibility weather, such as fog, rain, and snow, thereby enhancing the effectiveness of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
llm_teaser: "Revolutionize visibility in low-light and adverse weather conditions with the Time to Angle Sorting Camera, an innovative add-on that enhances object recognition and situational awareness for driver assistance and autonomous vehicles."

ip_name: Mechanism of Tissue Regeneration
ip_description: This invention is a biodegradable patch seeded with human neonatal dermal fibroblasts and human-induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes, which helps regenerate endogenous cardiomyocytes in adult murine, rat and swine models of myocardial infarction as a cause of chronic heart failure (CHF). This invention details changes in specific gene expression pathways with the recruitment of macrophages, as the mechanism of action of tissue regeneration. These pathways are not specific for cardiac muscle; thus, the researchers propose that these pathways could stimulate tissue regeneration for any tissue or organ in the body. Regenerative medicine plays an important role in the development and application of new treatments to recover the damaged tissues and organs and restore their functions which were lost due to aging or disease. Current studies in the field focus on the regenerative mechanisms of neonatal mammals and non-mammals that have innate regenerative potential. This new study focuses on regenerative mechanisms on adult animals.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention features a biodegradable patch containing human neonatal dermal fibroblasts and cardiomyocytes derived from human-induced pluripotent stem cells, aimed at regenerating cardiomyocytes in models of myocardial infarction. It highlights specific gene expression pathways involved in tissue regeneration, which may be applicable to various tissues and organs beyond cardiac muscle.

**Applications:** Potential applications include regenerative medicine for treating chronic heart failure, as well as broader uses in tissue and organ regeneration across multiple medical fields.

**Problem Solved:** The technology addresses the challenge of recovering damaged tissues and organs lost due to aging or disease by enhancing the body's innate regenerative capabilities, particularly in adult animals.
llm_teaser: Unlock the potential of tissue regeneration with our groundbreaking biodegradable patch that not only heals heart damage in adult models but also paves the way for restoring any tissue or organ in the body by harnessing the power of specific gene expression pathways.

ip_name: Novel Modalities for the Treatment of Cryptococcal Meningitis
ip_description: This invention is the repurposing of oxfendazole, an FDA-approved veterinary anthelmintic benzimidazole and its novel oral bioavailability enhancing formulations for the oral treatment of cryptococcal meningitis. The oxfendazole ionic liquid containing nano formulations can lead to the development of low-cost oral treatment for cryptococcal meningitis. Cryptococcal meningitis is a severe fungal infection of the central nervous system. Worldwide, nearly 220,000 new cases of cryptococcal meningitis occur each year, resulting in an estimated 181,000 deaths. Most of the illness and deaths are estimated to occur in resource-limited countries, among people living with HIV. Improved access to antiretroviral therapy (ART) globally has helped improve the immune systems of many HIV patients so that they are not at increased risk of cryptococcal meningitis. However, cryptococcal meningitis is still a major problem where HIV prevalence is high and where access to healthcare may be limited. This infection is extremely life threatening and has a high mortality rate. Despite the severity of the condition, there are few, if any, effective therapeutic options depending on the severity. Oxfendazole is a veterinary anthelmintic benzimidazole for the treatment of parasitic worms. The need for affordable antifungals to combat cryptococcal disease is unquestionable. Benzimidazoles are potentially attractive antifungal compounds that were introduced in clinical practice nearly 60 years ago to treat helminthic infections. In addition to being safe, their cost of treatment is extraordinarily low. Several studies suggested benzimidazoles as promising anticryptococcal agents combining low-cost and high antifungal efficacy. New formulations of oxfendazole have demonstrated improved oral bioavailability that can treat cryptococcal meningitis.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology involves the repurposing of oxfendazole, an FDA-approved veterinary drug, into novel formulations that enhance its oral bioavailability for treating cryptococcal meningitis. The development of low-cost oral treatments aims to address the high mortality rate associated with this severe fungal infection, particularly in resource-limited settings.

**Applications:** The primary use cases include the treatment of cryptococcal meningitis, particularly in HIV-positive patients, and potential applications in veterinary medicine due to oxfendazole's original purpose as an anthelmintic.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the urgent need for affordable and effective antifungal treatments for cryptococcal meningitis, which poses a significant health threat in areas with high HIV prevalence and limited healthcare access.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing the fight against cryptococcal meningitis, our innovative oxfendazole formulations offer a low-cost, highly effective oral treatment option that could save countless lives in resource-limited settings.

ip_name: Laser Generation Apparatus and Sources Using the Same
ip_description: This technology is an apparatus that uses a chirped pulse laser of wavelength λ1 combined with its second harmonic at λ2 to achieve a sum-frequency λ3. The chirp rate can be determined on a material basis and the process holds for λ2 = λ1/2, λ3 = λ1/3. This is achieved using nonlinear materials and the output is from a fiber source. Different material choices and λ2 chirp rates can be used relative to λ1 with repeatable input output conditions. Nonlinear optical crystals are being used more and more in lasers and photonics. This technology is one example of how the field is being revolutionized by the application of such materials. It is known that a laser can be manipulated by nonlinear optical materials to create white light, or a range of frequencies. Chirped or broadband beam cannot satisfy the phasematching condition for efficient wavelength conversion. The idea in this technology can be a solution for that, by making some monochromatic source into the sum of it and its harmonic (λ3).
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology involves a laser generation apparatus that utilizes a chirped pulse laser at wavelength λ1 and its second harmonic at λ2 to produce a sum-frequency output at λ3. It employs nonlinear materials, allowing for adjustable chirp rates and repeatable input-output conditions, enhancing the capabilities of lasers and photonics.

**Applications:** Potential applications include advanced laser systems, photonics research, and the generation of white light or a range of frequencies for various scientific and industrial uses.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the challenge of efficiently converting wavelengths in chirped or broadband beams, which typically do not meet the phasematching condition necessary for effective wavelength conversion.
llm_teaser: Unlock the potential of nonlinear optics with our innovative Laser Generation Apparatus, which seamlessly transforms monochromatic laser sources into a versatile sum-frequency output, enabling unprecedented control over wavelength conversion and expanding the horizons of photonics technology.

ip_name: Eco-Friendly, Sustainable, Lightweight, Porous Cellulose Sponge for Crop Growth
ip_description: This technology uses ‘cellulose sponges’ that can be used to grow pick-and-eat crops without soil. The inventors have tested diverse cellulose derivatives and have determined the best performers. Hydroxyethyl methylcellulose was shown in testing to have a higher water-retention property, higher durability, low density and malleability, and equal performance when compared to current rockwool systems. The crosslinked nature of the technology overcomes the common drawback of current sponges’ material releasing lots of dust and loose fiber that can be dangerous to humans in closed environments. The technology does not threaten respiratory systems while maintaining lower density and high water-retention properties. The other challenge is needed soil to grow crops with the sponges. To overcome this challenge and simplify the cellulose-based plant growth system, the technology controlled the component-structure-property-processing of cellulose materials for plant growth without soil. Furthermore, by testing diverse cellulose derivatives, the inventors identified the best performers to grow pick-and-eat crops, such as lettuce. Cellulose is the most abundant natural biopolymer with a global reserve of up to 75 billion tons from a variety of sustainable sources such as wood, plants, and algae. Due to the good safety profile of these biopolymers to humans and the environment, cellulose and its derivatives are widely used as a binder, thickener, emulsifier, and dispersing agent in various applications such as food, cosmetic and personal care, pharmaceutics, construction, and agriculture. Food-grade cellulose derivatives were crosslinked with food-grade citric acid to construct hydrogels with high water-retention properties. This cellulose hydrogel was buried under the soil and successfully grew a plant with the benefit of providing water and nutrients longer than just soil itself. Although direct plant growth on cellulose materials without soil would be more convenient, the small pores in the cellulose hydrogel prevent the roots from penetrating through and thus, a plant supporting system, such as soil, is required.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This technology features eco-friendly, lightweight, and porous cellulose sponges designed for growing pick-and-eat crops without soil. Hydroxyethyl methylcellulose has been identified as a superior material due to its high water retention, durability, and low dust emission, making it safer for use in closed environments.

**Applications:** The technology can be utilized in agriculture for growing crops such as lettuce, as well as in various industries that require cellulose derivatives, including food, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, and construction.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the challenges of soil-based crop growth by providing a sustainable alternative that maintains high water retention and safety, while also mitigating the health risks associated with dust and loose fibers from traditional sponge materials.
llm_teaser: "Revolutionizing agriculture, our Eco-Friendly Cellulose Sponge enables soil-less crop growth with superior water retention and durability, ensuring a sustainable future for pick-and-eat produce without compromising health or the environment."

ip_name: Non-Scanning, Multi-Aperture Confocal Microscope
ip_description: This invention relates to the design of a low cost, multi-aperture confocal microscope that can provide cellular images of human tissue in vivo. The main purpose is to use non-scanning all-passive confocal optics to conduct two-dimensional confocal imaging. The invention uses multiple apertures for each of the illumination and detection masks to increase the imaging speed and improve image resolution compared to a single aperture. This can be used for diagnosis of skin diseases, corneal diseases, and other human diseases, as well as industrial inspection applications, such as inspection of defects on flat panel display devices. Microscopes have been an integral part of the medical field since their first use in 1563, and currently remain one of the most important diagnostic devices. Current microscopes utilize a single aperture to obtain images; however, advancements in the optical field have radically improved microscopes through the use of multi-apertures and approaches that improve image resolution and increased imaging speeds. Applications include medical imaging, non-invasive diagnostic tool, and industrial inspection applications. Advantages include higher resolution images, increased imaging speeds, the ability to provide cellular images of in vivo human tissue, and lower cost.
llm_summary:
**Summary:** This invention is a low-cost, non-scanning, multi-aperture confocal microscope designed for in vivo cellular imaging of human tissue. It utilizes multiple apertures for illumination and detection to enhance imaging speed and resolution compared to traditional single-aperture systems.

**Applications:** The technology is applicable in medical imaging for diagnosing skin and corneal diseases, as well as in industrial inspection for detecting defects in flat panel display devices.

**Problem Solved:** This technology addresses the limitations of traditional microscopes that use a single aperture, offering higher resolution images and faster imaging capabilities while reducing costs.
llm_teaser: Revolutionizing medical diagnostics and industrial inspections, the Non-Scanning, Multi-Aperture Confocal Microscope delivers high-resolution, real-time cellular imaging of human tissue in vivo at unprecedented speeds and lower costs.

ip_name: Flash Lidar with FOV Expansion
ip_description: This technology is a method of capturing high-resolution images in laser, imaging, detection and ranging (LIDAR) with a 10x increase in field of view using Digital Micromirror Devices (DMDs) and 2D array detectors such as Multi-Pixel Photon Counters (MPPC). It utilizes the receiver field of view expansion technique, which was achieved by diffractively redirecting light to the sensor with synchronized DMDs and 2-dimensional arrayed detectors. Due to the critical safety concerns surrounding the automotive industry push toward autonomous driving, new innovations are needed in areas such as pedestrian detection and avoidance, lane departure warning and correction, traffic sign recognition, automatic emergency braking, and blind spot detection. These lifesaving systems are key to the success of advance driving assistance systems (ADAS) and rely on future enhancements to the latest interface standards in order to run multiple vision-based algorithms to support real-time multimedia, vision coprocessing and sensor fusion subsystems. This technology helps enhance the capabilities of Advanced Driver Assistance Systems by making them faster and more reactive, more efficient, and more capable by increasing the field of view and decreasing the relay time. This invention also has the potential to provide needed technological advancements in the field of aviation, specifically autonomous aircraft operations and possibly aircraft defense systems.
